text: Aroma: tart with tons of barnyard funk; Appearance: clear yellow pour with creamy white head; Taste: several different stages; starts tart, becomes funky, then fruity, then a little funky again; wow; Palate: light bodied with light, funky finish; Overall: excellent. Would love to get again.
Bottle shared. Pours cloudy gold with no head. Aroma is white wine, light banana, Brett. Flavour is tart dough, with a pepper slight green apple cider sweet finish. Lovely beer.
Draft at Baghaven. Aroma is bomb of wilderness, barnyard, fruity, grass, citrus. Moderate sweet with fruits, slight lactic, malt, hay, bready. Lovely tart finish! Gotta try it bottled next time!

Draft at Armsby Abbey. Pours golden with a thick white head. Leaves a shitload of lacing in the glass. Lots of funk and hoppy horse blanket on the nose. Plenty of horse blanket and funk on the tongue but also a hint of sourness which is really intriguing. Finish lingers a bit. These folks seemingly make nothing but beautiful beer.

Small pours, from a bottle at a tasting / bottle share on 4-14-17. 2014 bottle; about 2.5 years old at time of tasting. Pours a clear gold with much head. Great lacing. Bright liquid. Pleasant, fruity aroma. Nice, tart taste. Clay and dirt flavors. Subtle and sophisticated flavor. Reserved; not obvious. Light to medium body. Soft in the palate. Very pleasant beer, even if its not in-your-face.

4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey during the Hill Farmstead tap takeover on 4/1/2017. Not an April Fools Joke. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of funk, floral notes, herbs, citrus, tropical fruit. Tastes of tart notes, citrus, funk. Medium body with a dry finish.
Really nice saison, a great funk of bread and hay and barniness. Full bodied and a nice tart palate that makes you come back for more.

Well, Im not going to get long winded about this. Im giving this my first ten in any category ever. By and far the best beer Ive ever had. I kill ipas all day, but really enjoy artful saison. And, this is it. Picked this bottle up yesterday at the source, split it with coldbrewky relaxing at the kitchen table. Hazy light yellow in the glass. Feint white head. Incredible lemon farmhouse yeast funk. Palate is right behind it. Teetering on the brink of a berliner, but with much more time and attention put into it. Perfectly balanced. Doesnt end, just fades away. Ill drive all the way back for another. Ive found nirvana.

Bottle, courtesy of luttonm, shared @King Arthur (Ciampino), thank you very much Matt! Pours cloudy yellow with a fine foam. Aroma of delicate brett, leather, barnyard, a vinous touch, white flowers, citrus, apricot. Flavour is powerful and complex but refined, amazing white wine notes, citrusy, high persistence. Medium to high body, fine carbonation. A real world class beer!

Clear golden yellow with frothy white head... Aroma of lemon, earthy grains, light pepper, hay, light funk... Flavor is supremely drinkable, the perennial saison, light earthy grains, lemon, lime, hints of funk, pepper and yeast on finish... Delicious

At Hopishops B.U.M.B. tasting, one of Hill Farmsteads better known beers, a farmhouse ale with bubbly, moussy, snow white, frothy, well-retaining head and clear yellow blonde robe with warmer old gold hue. Aroma of moldy lemon, soggy white bread, freshly whipped sour cream, sourdough, damp hay, something sulfuric not unlike cooked green cabbage, fresh valerian flowers, stale urine even, pickled gherkins. Fruity, estery onset, lots of gooseberry, hints of lime, cucumber, unripe melon and yellow plum, soft sourness, softish carbo, fluffy, supple mouthfeel, soft malt sweetish core, bit bready, bit soapy as well, tartness increasing in the finish, drying, crisp, spicy hop note with soft bittering effect, quenching. The sulfuric hint in the nose bothered me a little bit at first, but this is an interesting wild ale in many respects, complex and quenching with a very pleasant mouthfeel; still I have the feeling it is the very limited distribution of these beers that are responsible for the hype surrounding this brewery, rather than the quality of the beers themselves, though the ones I tasted so far were all tasty and interesting.
At Hopishop 2016. Aroma of brett, grain and yeast. Taste has yeast, brett, citrus and soft grain. Nice tasty brett saisin, but rather overhyped on here.

Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen 20161001. Fruity, yeasty, spicy, hoppy, citrusy notes, light acidic, light funky, crisp, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, yeasty and fruity. Dry hopped version: same as above, but more funky 8 4 8 4 16.
From tap. Hazy golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, citrus, spice, tartness and brettanomyces.
Tap @ Mikkeller and friends, Copenhagen 1/10-16. Fruity and yeasty with citrus and some spices, also light acidic. Body is medium, the finish is dry and fruity with some notes of spices.
Tap @ mikkeller and friends. Pours a golden colour beer with a medium head. Fruity with citrus, yeast and notes of spices. Dry finish

DH Cascade @ Mikkeller Bar. Aroma of hay, tart orange, lemon, barn, blanket. 
Pours a relatively clear golden with a dense white head that lasts well. 
Taste is more complex with brett character, fruity tartness, hay and barnyardy notes. Medium light bitterness and light to medium sweetness. 
Medium body, average carbonation, slightly creamy mouthfeel, brett finish and a some bitterness. Nice stuff but would have wished for more Cascade character in the aroma.
Bottle shared. What a great treat! Amazing balance, drinks like juicy lemon tart in a glass, lovely dry finish. HF steals the show once again, masterpice!
Copenhagen Beer Celebration Boston: pours gold with white head. Aroma is vinegar and brett funk. Refreshing tartness and lemon. Pretty nice. dank.

Dry hopped Arthur. Incredible aroma wheat, straw and citrus. Very refreshing. Fruity and citrusy. Wheat, straw, yeast, and citrus. Effervescent and tart. Extremely good.

W/ Cascade. Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Aroma of citrus and fruity brett, citrus hops. Hazy yellow with lasting white head. Taste is moderate bitter, dry and a light tartness. Medium body, dry feel, brett bitter finish.

Rating number 2300 and my first Hill Farmstead. Thanks for sharing the bottle Tim! Pours a hazy, lemon colored straw with a finger of foam that lingers. Tart lemon zest on the nose with some iyokan and tangerine aromas. More tart than I expected but pleasantly so. Very active carbonation. Light bodied with a slight yogurt character. Dry finish. Fantastic saison.

Pours yellowish white, creamy. Aroma is fresh, citrusy and with some herbal kick up front. Sour notes. Tastes lightly tart, citrusy goodness, smooth and highly drinkable. Like a lemon tart. Delicious.

Very hazy chalk white color. Frothy white head. Tart, funky, citrusy, dry, hoppy with a bit of bandaid that works well in the nose. Very tart, citrusy, funky, decent amount of brett, dry and hoppy. Perfectly balanced and put together. A bit more sour than I expected, but I love it. Estry finish with some citrus notes just lingering. Amazing.

(On tap @ Warpigs HF Day, Copenhagen, May 12 2016) Pours hazy orange-gold with basically no head. Aroma of peach, punchy grapefruit, herbal, grassy hops, peppery phenolics, strawberry seeds, semi-sweet pale malts, yeast, moderately high funk. Flavour is sweet-tart at first with grapefruit, tart orange, fruity, peachy ester profile, peppery herbal notes, light wet hay funk, dry finish with moderate herbal hop bitterness, slightly bready quality, lightly mineral. Medium mouthfeel, almost creamy, low but filling carbonation. A very nice, well-balanced saison.

Sampled at THT August. Bottle. Murky golden, thin white head. Sweet malts, grassy, elderflower, floweriness, grapefruit, milky. Light sweet, mild sour and mild salty minerallikeness. Medium body, soft carbonation, milky and minerallike texture.

Bottle at THT. Bit hazy bright golden with white head. Lemon, quite some spicy yeast, some flowers, lime, light fresh baked bread, soft sour berries. Under medium sweet sour and bitter. Medium bodied with soft fizzy carbonation. Nice!

Draft at anchorage brewing, hazy yellow beer, nice white head. Aroma is faint kombucha and lemon. Taste is light lemon, slightly pale malty, black pepper. Very light and clean, carbonation subdued in spite of active head.

(Hill Farmstead Arthur) Bottle 750ml at home, served into a teku, ABV 6%
Bright sunny yellow colour on the body, clear, with almost two fingers of thick, snow white head on top, with average retention.
Aroma has citrus, fresh grass, light peppery notes, 
Taste is mildly sour, with light floral notes, citrus, grass, some funky character, lemon zest.
Medium thin body, good carbonation, tangy on the palate.
Very nice saison.
THX to Yngwie 250316. Golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is lemon, citrus, yeast, floral. flavour is sourness, brett, citrus, lemon, citrus, yeast, floral, orange. Very nice beer.

This was a fresh (~1 month old) bottle, and I was expecting the brett funk to dominate this young, but it had a remarkably developed sourness -- the taste was all cider and green apples. I'm not big on saisons, but but this is damn good. The mouth feel is light and crisp with an excellent carbonation and a lingeringly smooth, crisp finish. Hot damn is this a good beer

Pours bright light orange with a foamy two finger white head with fantastic lacing. Aroma is of sour fruits, wet hay, sourdough bread, barnyard funk, citrus peels, tropical fruits, musty wood, fresh cut grass, and herbs. Taste is sour fruits, sourdough bread, wet hay, light barnyard, grass, tropical fruits, citrus peel, and some herbal notes. Has a medium body with a creamy mouthfeel and a dry, mostly sour, long finish. Overall, a another excllent, world class saison from the best brewery in the world.

Draft (Monks Cafe, Philly).
Head is initially small, frothy, white, mostly diminishing.
Body is hazy light yellow.
Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), lightly hoppy (herbs), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with notes of lemon/lime juice, sour apple, wood, band aid.
Flavor is moderately sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.
Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.
A competent but unexciting sour ale. Its a pity to find HF is making trendy Americanized sour/wild ales in the vein of Anchorage and many others. I honestly dont find anything special in this even though theres nothing wrong with it. After this and Dorothy, its quite clear Blackberry Farm is the brewery to beat in the US for classic saisons.

Embouteillée 22/07/2015, bue après 4 mois. Robe dorée voilée surmonté dun beau col de mousse blanc et laiteux. Arômes se citron, levures, orange, pain blanc frais. Notes florales et léger sucre résiduel qui vient atténuer les effluves citronnées. En bouche, citron, jus dorange fraîchement pressé, levures épaisses. Encore cette sensation florale pas désagréable du tout. Pointes de grains maltés et de légers agrumes venant des houblons. Liquide dune fraîcheur et équilibre presque sans faille. Bien sur, le citron est à lhonneur mais il est enveloppé dans une texture onctueuse ou plutôt laiteuse où les levures saffirment. Finale plus amère et fruitée venant des agrumes. Superbe.

On tap at Churchville Inn. Appearance is yellow, hazy, small white head. Aroma is slight friut ester, wheat. Taste is lemon, sour apple also some wheat and grains. Smooth feel even with low carboation.

Bottle shared by Darrin in the line for Blåbær Release 2015. Pours a pale yellow with a big, white head. Aroma has sweet, belgian style esters, elderflower, funk and oak. Slight wheat and a bit of hops. Taste is more dry and funky, slightly hoppy and slightly tart, but very oaky. High carbonation and smooth, sparkling body.
Pours yellow with a white head which largely remains. Aroma is citrus lemon, herbs, pepper. Taste is citrus lemon, slight bitterness, slight bitter orange, slight herbs, and pepper.
2014 vintage, thanks Leighton. Horsey funk, some light citrus. Lightly bitter and tangy, drier. Chewy, lighter body. Very effervescent. Excellent.

Maybe not the most representative saison in the world - but possibly the best.

Surprisingly sour, with lemon, yeast, and a background Brett funk. Nice lacing on the glass, perfect carbonation level, and a sticky, lingering finish. Packed with an incredible amount of flavor & depth.

Even though the hops are a big part of the flavor, I could definitely see this beer getting even better with some cellaring to take the edge off some of the sharper notes. Still, this is as close to a flawless beer as Ive had in a long time.
Bottle pour at Travlrs Mini Bottle Share gathering. Cloudy yellow with moderate white head. Lemon, yeast, herbs. Light and lively with a dry finish. Damn good.
From a bottle at the RB DC tasting September 6. It is a cloudy light yellow color with a slight head. The aroma is similar to a saison and the taste is coriander and lemon.
From a bottle at the RB DC tasting September 6. Pours a hazy gold with a thick white head. Light spicy aroma. Flavors of coriander and lemon.

On tap at the Farmhouse Tap. 2012 keg, so they say. Served in a wine glass. Originally reviewed 7/21/2013.
 Bright orange yellow. Nice white head. Nice lacing. Good rention.

 Aroma is lemony. Slightly yeasty. Pale malt.
 Stone fruits. Very crisp taste. Tart and a little floral. Strong yeast and herbal bitterness. Pale malt. Some white wine notes and oak? That shouldnt be.
Light and crisp. Nice tang. A little bit yeasty. For some reason Im getting wine and oak from this, but its the only time I ever got it from Arthur.

Bottle, via trade with JulienHuxley (thanks!), and shared with Parksy. Hazy pale yellow with a lively white head that laces thickly. Beautiful complexity, rustic yeast and crackery pale malts, lemon peel, light pepper, grape must, footy undertones. Finish is dry. An outstanding archetype of the style.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: While this brew is not my style for sure,.. I had to try it just because of the name... Moderated sourness that gets trough, and better as feared before opening. Hoppy and citrus. I can imagin some people really like this kind of beer.

Hazy pale yellow colour, white head. Aroma of hops, yeast, resin, fruity notes. Light tart, fruity flavour, bitter, malts and citrus. Bitter finish, orange peel, malts and yeast.(from 75cL bottle @ Lets drink all of Richs American beers Tasting. Thanks for sharing, omgrich!)
Bottle: Poured a hazy yellow with white head. Aroma was funky earthy and fruit. Taste was soured grain with fruit and some funk.

This is cloudy orange w/ a white head of mixed bubbles and a ton of lacing. Its got a funky, fruity nose w/ lots of lemon citrus and a touch of grassiness. This has solid tartness to it and is overall fresh and juicy tasting. Its medium bodied w/ creamy carbonation but still crisp and drinkable. This is another good one from Hill Farmstead.
At Richs Massive Cellar Emptying Tasting. Hills farmstead Arthur light cloudy gold earthy tart lemony aroma. Raspy mouthfeel dry finish and lovely soft lemon sour flavor. 3.7-3.8

Dry hopped version (DHVAR01) -- Hopped with Styrian Goldings and conditioned in stainless. 

Bottle. Pours a beautiful, hazy pale yellow with a large, fluffy white head. Aromas of HF yeast, citrus, lemon, some spice/light pepper. Taste is light to just shy of moderately bitter. Can taste Arthur in the background, but the bitterness is not kind to him. Some citrus, a touch tart, and an unmistakeable "earthiness" accompanying this. Light bodied, average carbonation, a slight bitterness in the finish. I definitely prefer the regular version of Arthur.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a hazy gold with thick white head. Aroma is fruity with Belgian spices, grass and sour funkiness. Taste is mild to moderately sour overall with flavors of tropical fruits, Belgian yeast and Brett, grains, lemon. Pretty tasty and great for a warm day. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at LeninCats. Thanks Lenin! Pours a hazy golden color with white head. Hazy, straw, yeast aromas. Tart, straw, citrus, yeast, peppery flavors. Pretty tasty!

(750ml bottle) cloudy medium gold, thick creamy white head, nice lacing on the glass. Nose of oats, Belgian yeast, light noble hops, clean, citrusy, orange peel, and a touch of brett. Taste of citrus peel, lemon, brett, oats, bright, zesty. Medium to high carbonation, delicious finish, bright and citrusy. So easy to drink. Dont want it to end.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow. Aroma is lemon zest, bready malts, light toast barnyard funk, and some grassy notes. Flavor is dry and funky with light floral and grassy notes, fresh citrus, and light toast. Medium body.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2016 October 2014 Magnum drunk 7/25/15.The mark of a fine saison lies in its perfect appearance. Thats not true at all, but Dupont, Blaugies, Thiriez and Fantome all have wonderful heads with near-perfect retention. That is true for Mr. Hills Belgian offerings and this one is no different. Bright golden appearance with just a touch of haziness and white head atop.Absolute crazy aroma. High acidity with light plaster, cedar and some grassiness. Very similar phenol profile to Dupont; nice and peppery, dry. Reserved but ample funkiness combined with American hop notes (light juicy fruits and stone fruits, plentiful floral notes, minor citrus). No alcohol and no flaws.The flavor is acidic, very brightly so and carried on by a tight carbonation and malty yet not sweet texture. Lots of honey-like notes from the malt and a good dose of pepper and tart acids to keep things very dry. Vibrant and lush and all this with 9 months of age on it.  I could see this being a bit too brash/powerful very fresh and probably very interesting and potentially incredible after a couple more years. Much like Id imagine an American-hopped Dupont to be. Wonderfully drinkable with lime-like brett, honey, meyer lemon and black pepper all lingering nicely on the finish. Flavor dosent quite live up to the aroma for me, however.  Theres just a bit too much tropical fruit like acidity and sourdough-like breadiness.  Maybe a touch of alcohol in the flavor, as well (very similar to the light alcohol I get from Duponts saison).  9/5/7/4/16Cascade dry-hopped version 2016 drunk 5/30 and 6/3/16.Was pretty let down by this one all around.  Very aggressive beer which is unusual for HF.  Lots of bitterness and a slightly hard texture with very little complexity.  Somewhat bready too with lots of perfume and strong spiciness.  Messy.  Eh.  Rating is a combination of the two batches Ive had.  7/5/7/3/13

Poured from magnum thanks AdamChandler Oct 2014 for the Ratebeer Farmhouse Magnum Tasting. Golden pour with a one finger head. Aromas of grass citrus pine and yeast. Taste is amazing wild yeast grass and balanced citrus.

Bouteille 750ml. Couleur dorée translucide, mousse blanche nuageuse laissant une dentelle éparse. Arôme de levure, malt pâle, houblon fruité, zeste de pamplemousse. Goût de citron, levure, malt, légère acidité, légèrement poivré, amertume moyenne. Carbonatation moyen, corps moyen, texture ample.
Vinegar, sour apples, tartness with a golden yellow hue. This is almost like a Saison crossed with a Gose.
Poured a cloudy golden color with a white head. Aromas of citrus, yeasty, and spices. Tastes of citrus and spices..Amazing beer

Bottle to glass. Pours a slightly hazy light orange deep golden color with an off white head. Aroma is mild, pleasant, dry, slight citrus, funk. Flavor has a nice tartness to it with lemon zest, orange peel, yeast, funk. Very drinkable. Very nice.
750ml bottle pours a hazy golden color with a bit of head. Nice wild yeast flavor with a bit of marmalade tartness.

This poured a slightly hazy gold with a rather thick head. The aroma is mostly dark fruits and possibly licorice and caramel. It has a subtle sweetness overtaken by an indistinct spiciness and fruitiness. I think I like it....
Bottle, thanks Tim! Aroma is sour lemon, black pepper, and grain. Tastes the same. Very tart. Light sourness. Lots of lemon juice. Really good and easy to drink but I like other HF saisons more.
Bottle: Cloudy pale gold because I got the pour from the bottom of the bottle. Rubber aroma with a taste akin to a sour ale. Well done. Farmhouse style.
Funky sour saison some soapy flavors clean finish very nice beer by hanks Trevor

Bottle through an awesome trade. Pours a clear yellow gold, huge fluffy white head tons of spider web like lace. Nose most definitely sour. Tastes tart, and possibly a little of wheat. This is so light, refreshing and just perfect on so many levels. There may be a slight touch of Brett in there somewhere.

Date on the side of the bottle reads 02/2015.
This was poured into a tulip.
The appearance was a hazy yellow color with a soft foamy white head that dissipated within less than a minute. Lacing is somewhat stringy.
The smell starts off with a nice sweet citrus to rustic funk. White grapes, lemon, lemongrass enliven to bring about an extra little spice - what seems like peppercorn.
The taste takes the sweet to combine nicely with the rustic and the funk through the previously mentioned flavors. Spice (peppercorn) comes back to balance and add an extra little kick to it. As it warms, it gets a slight sour to tart edge to it and its absolutely fantastic. Theres no aftertaste and it has a quick little sweet to rustic to slightly sour finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a super nice sessionability about it. Carbonated nicely as a saison, Id say this had a nice semi-spicy to sour to tart feel over my tongue.
Overall, hot damn, probably the absolute best Hill Farmstead beer Ive had to date.
June 19, 2015 - bottle via trade. Clear yellow pour with some head and lacing. Aroma was citrus, spice, grain and funk.
Tap. Hazy light golden pour. Tart, lemon and fruits. Medium body and long finish. Very nice
Clean lightly dry, yet fruity saison. Brett is there, but subdued in a way that lets a bit of the malt sweetness come through--more so than some of the other HF saisons I have had. Really nice beer.

75cl bottle into tulip. Minneapolis. 

Pours pale yellow with heavy haze. Small white head with lacing. 

Aroma is tart. A little earthy underneath. 

Taste is tart, a little sweetness underneath. 

Medium- light body. Clean. Longer finish.
On tap at City Beer Hall in Albany. Served in a snifter. A glowing light orange color. Funky and fruity citrus aromas and flavors. Dry yeasty mouthfeel. Tart throughout. Dont call this a Saison.
Thanks to the young guns. Pale yellow pour. Citrus malty aroma. Lemony light malt taste. Real nice.

The beer is a light golden yellow with a big white head. Its fairly cloudy with a good sized white head. Excellent retention. The aroma is wonderfully fresh with bright grain sweetness. Earthy yeast complexity. Its just wonderfully pleasant. Lemony note in the taste. Mushrooms, earth, a little bit of dust. Soft feel, quite light.
Bottled 03/15. Pours light yellow. Lemonade color. Aroma is tart funk lemon, light pepper, really nice. Flavor is lots of lemon zest, acidic. Great.

sampler from a bomber. poured and hazy yellow with nice white head. this was the beer of the night. huge citrus nose and funk and Belgian yeast. light bodied. the flavor was tart tangy lemon, and citrus very light and dry on the end excellent summer beer this is only the 2nd beer from this brewery I have had and damn. it was just amazingly good. how does it get any better.

Trade from Pandableh. Thanks buddy. Hazy yellow body with a large white forever lasting head, beautiful. Citrus, brett, lemon, hops, grapefruit, lemon peel, lime. Wow this is so freakin delicious. A bretty citrus juice bomb. Again just wow.
Bottle brought by AdamJackson, thanks alot! Smells like Brett-heaven, citrus, hay. Taste is spectacular, citrus, motherfreakin' good. Awesome beer, which I'd have this all day.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2015 750mL dated 07/14, from HFS to my cellar to my glass. Pours cloudy orange gold with a white head. Aroma is hay, a bit of citrus and acetic. Very pleasant. This has the usual HFS softness, hay, bright citrus.

Ive had a few bottles of this before, guess its time to throw a rating in. Although I have both fresh and 1 year old bottles, Im choosing to rate the old bottle to see how it has evolved. Pours a hazed light straw color with a massive head (Brett propelled?) aromas are of citrus, hay and funk. Taste is dry and slightly bitter. Pronounced barnyard funk. Obviously has at least Brett in it, possibly lacto as well. Flavors of tart sunshine, musty funky cobwebs, light cheese. Floral hops for a distraction. Finish is bone dry, with a lasting funk. World class, as always.

Bière jaune paille de type saison sauvage sûre. La tête blanche comme neige coiffe cette belle bière dun magnifique col rafraîchissant et éclatant de blancheur. Au nez, je perçois du citron, une acidité ferme et de la levure saison sauvage à profusion. En bouche, le tout est très sec, pétillant et sûrette. Les saveurs de citron sont présentes et à celles-ci sajoutent le côté sauvagin de létable. De la sueur. Cette saison sauvage est très bien faite mais trop unidirectionnelle à mon goût. Aurait mérité plus de complexité.
Note: cette bière faisait laccompagnement dune salade Fattouche maison. Lensemble était parfaitement harmonieux. Je la recommande avec un plat de ce type: acide, frais et légèrement épicé.
Lovely soft funk with a light stone fruit. Pearlescent yellow with light foamy head. Amazing smooth light crisp slight funk so delicious. Amazing beer.

Hazy yellow with thin white head. Thank you srsili btw! Mushroom earthiness, lemons, limes, rindy really. Mildly tart. Grapefruit. Esters kicked off all over. This lifts, not even a style I enjoy anymore.

Many thanks to Ron for providing the bottle!

Pours a hazy sun-yellow color, with a big, froth head.

Has aromas of wet grass, hay, citrus green apple peel and a lovely, slightly fruity, acidity. Bretts blend well into the rustic characteristics of the nose, providing an enjoyable freshness. The nose reminds me more of a Berliner Weisse, than a classic Saison, while being a bit richer and more pronounced on the nose.

Has a lively, very refreshing carbonation. While the beer is still relatively low in alcohol, its got a decent body to it.

Begins with soft wheat, wet hay and acidic lime, inviting sour bretts to the palate. Has a truly refreshing beginning, almost mirroring the nose, balanced by bready, slightly biscuity malts. Taste is still without a doubt providing a very pleasant freshness, with the right amount of lactic citrus fruit among funky yeast and wheat. Ends with biscuity malts among citrus bonbons, revealing a good amount of sourness.

A real treat, my first Hill Farmstead brew, a fuller bodied Berliner Weisse - or a truly refreshing, sessionable saison. Either way, the beer provides a crisp, citraic freshness, well edged into a distinct wheat foundation leading to a very well composed brew, I would love to drink frequently during warm summer days.
Une saison parfaite : arôme sauvage et citronné, acidité maitrisée. La bouche est dune pureté inouïe! Des notes de froment. Extremely drinkable!

Bottle thanks to Adam. Pours a cloudy yellow color with a large white head. A light fruity spicy nose. The flavor is big oak, big coriander, floral hops. Gentle and well made. Big lemons. Smooth. Very easy.

750ml bottle. Cloudy yellow. Lots of white foam. Aroma is lemon zest, floral, grassy. Delicate but powerful and satisfying. Taste is not excessively dry, as I thought it might be. There is a slight sweetness here. Not quite as good as I was hoping it might be but displays HFs usual class and balance.

Thank you so much b3shine for this generous gift. I am forever in your debt. This beer just screams simplicity, elegance, and sophistication. Pours a nice lemon yellow with crazy mountains of pillow soft white head. Aromas are sweet Belgian yeast and juicy pineapple. A beautiful sour edge to this.. Funk, white wine, Belgian candy, such a good saison.

Bottle Share: Hazy golden hue and okay fluffly head. Notes of lemon, slight barnyard, biscuit, herbs, touch of pine and citrus and some minerally earth tones. I nice Saison but I must say I hoped to be floored and that did not happen.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2016 Poured into a taster glass showing cloudy straw yellow with a finger of fluffy clean white foam. 

The nose shows slight bretty and lemon notes with a farmhouse background.

The palate is light bodied, moderately but sharply tart, highly carbonated with flavors of lemon zest and very little farmhouse flavor. Theres a slight spice on the palate and a pilsner-like bitterness at the end.

Bottle shared with my wife sent to me from Tom10101, thanks man! Yellow hazy colour with lively white head. Aroma is tart citrus funk, white grapes, and grass. Taste is lemon zest, followed by light funk, then a citrus lemongrass burst. Finishes dry, medium mouthfeel, plenty of carbonation. Fantastic stuff, tons of juicy citrus flavour, very refreshing and a pleasure to drink.
October batch I think. Golden pour, white head. Nose is minerals, fresh water, light citrus. Taste is tart, minerals, very drinkable.
Bottle, pours orange with white head. Aroma is light tart and yeast. Taste is more tart than i expected, really tasty

Au nez, on sent les fruits tropicaux sûrs. Fruits de la passion, mangue, ananas et des agrumes ressortent accompagnés de levures. En bouche, c'est très intense sur le bout et cotés de la langue. Surette, mais pas trop, la levure est bien présente toujours secondée par tous ces fruits. La finale s'estompe plus rapidement que ce à quoi je m'attendais. Très fine et agréable. C'est une autre biere d'exception de Russian River!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared at Borefts day1 26/09/2014. Bodegraven. Many thanks to whoever brough this. Hazed yellow/ golden coloured pour with a thin white head. Aroma is nice sharp lemon citrus, lemon serbert, and some floral notes. Flavour is composed of crisp sharp lemon, nice floral cirtus, Palate is medium bodied crisp and refreshing. Good stuff.

Light straw coloured with a bright green reflection and a frothy white head. Noses lightly of barnyard/cellar, green apple lightly floral and wet fresh green grass. Softly carbonated/light effervescent and light bodied.Well pronounced green fruit acidity with some sweet underpinning and a clear hop bitterness. Medium-long dry finish.

2014 bottle. Hazy light straw color with a fizzy white head. Nice barnyard, lemon and slightly sour smell. Taste is funky grain, with lemon and lots of peppery spice and sourness/bitterness. Effervescent, dry mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy lemon yellow with a thin white head that settles to a film and leaves decent lacing. Aroma has a barnyard smell with a bit of lemon and plastic. Taste has lemon and light pear with herbal hops, some barnyard and some light medicinal taste. Finishes dry with a bit of herbal hops. Light mouthfeel and body with high carbonation. Fairly complex and easy drinking.

A golden wheat color, slightly hazy, ample amount of white fluffy head. Smells of Funky barnyard, coriander, perm, citrus. Taste is peppery citrus, wheat, coriander, a chemical/plastic like hop bitter. Bubbly funky farmhouse, interesting flavors, don't care too much for the bitter but still good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: Thanks Madseeg: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Medium to bigger sized white head. Hazy yellow colored beer.
Aromas of yeast, lemon, white wood, lemon peel, sawdust, some soap and flowers.
Flavours ofyeast, bitters, lemon peel, tart, herbs, wood, some soap and flower tones, fruits and cactus.
Aftertaste bitter, tart, yeast, wood and some different fruits (lemon, cactus, grapes...)
Low carbo, creamy light tart mouthfeel, more than just medium bodied.
Deliciously balanced and refreshing.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
Un nuage de mousse blanche immaculée laisse une dentelle suave sur les parois du verre, celui-ci étant rempli dun liquide doré et embrouillé.
Au nez, la rusticité de la souche de levure maison dégage de légères notes poussiéreuses samalgamant aux houblons floraux utilisés en parcimonie pour ne pas compromettre laspect fermier de la bière.
En bouche, des saveurs citriques et dagrumes sont rehaussées par la carbonatation virulente et une franche acidité qui rend latteinte de la satiété très difficile! Des céréales mordantes confèrent une certaine complexité à un produit sauvagement simple, mais exécuté à la perfection.
Un des meilleurs exemples en sol nord-américain de ce que doit être une Saison authentique.

Very classic, old world saison. Usually on this side of the pond theres a lot less carbonation. If I did a blind taste test, Id have a hard time distinguishing this guy from the better European brewed versions.

From 75 cl bottle in tulip. Pour is slightly hazy golden straw with a frothy white head. The nose is citrus, green apples, Belgian yeast and a bit wild. In the mouth, its a firework of flavors that reminds me a bit of Cantillon beers. Pungent sourness with funky horse flavors, citrus, and lots of tartness. Toward the end the bitterness gets stronger with a taste of unripe apples. Medium carbonation. Excellent Saison!

Bottle shared at the 9th Richmond Rare & Unusual Epic Tasting, Richmond, VA, 11/30/14. Pours a milk lemon with a thin fizzy white head. Aroma of wheat, floral notes, tart lemon, funk. The taste is tart, bright citrus, vegetal and floral notes, pale malt, mild funk. Medium bodied, lingering tartness.

05/2014 bottle courtesy of Johnny. 
Aroma has a nice light graininess with bright phenolic notes of coriander and lemongrass. Moderate citrus notes of lemon, orange and lime. Some light stone fruit notes. 
Pours a pale, cloudy, yellow gold with a moderately sized, thick white head with good retention and moderate lacing. 
Flavor is slightly sweet with moderate citrus notes of orange and lemon. Nice zesty character. Medium light phenolic notes. Medium light bitterness with light mineral finish. Hints of stone fruit and light acidity. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, a really nice beer with nice citrus and phenolic notes. Good finish with a balanced acidity.

Bottle @ home shared with my wife. Hazy golden pour with a huge frothy head. Nose has light yeast, funk, lemon juice and some herbal notes. Taste is spritzy with some citric notes, funk, yeast and light lemon.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2016 May 10, 2016. Bottle, Cascade Dry-hopped version, bottled February 16, 2016. 
Cloudy yellow with a large creamy, slowly dissipating white head. Aroma is funky with barnyard notes, lemon zest, hints of passionfruit, overripe peach, notes of grapes. Taste is tart citrusy, funky with some passionfruit tartness comin through in the finish. Medium bodied, dry texture, average carbonation. 


Original rating:

October 10, 2014. On tap at M&F.
 Hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is citrus, spicy, floral, light funky and a bit earthy..Taste is light sweet, light to medium tart citrus notes, dry and crisp tart citrus and spicy finish. Light bodied, average carbonation.


Get more of the passionfruit notes from the dry-hopped variant.

Bottle shared with the crazy bunch a: citrusy, barnyard . app: hazy pale white head t/p: med body with light acidic finish. Moderate to high carbonation. O: excellent. Super drinkable and refreshing. Like the funk and overall acidity.

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2015 Update: drank again but this time in better conditions. Bought at brewpub. Bottle thanks to Ben. Aroma: lemon, barnyard funkiness, sweet apples. App: hazy pale, minimal white head, some lacing. taste and palate: medium body, lemon, light sweetness, vinous, tad dry light sourness finish. Overall: really good. Like the sourness. So well balanced. I could see myself drinking this every day.
Almost hazy golden pour. Big white head. Plenty of lacing. Aroma is malt, lemon, and a bit of sourness. Taste is sour with plenty of citrus mixed in. Not bad.

750ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with generous foamy cream-colored head. Aroma is both fruity and spicy along the lines of Belgian yeasts. Intense flavors of orange peel and spices- more aggressive than one would guess by the aroma. Medium bodied with a somewhat tart finish. I enjoyed this.

Stellar saison by one of the best brewers in the world. Beautifully balanced: funky yeatiness, pale golden slightly hazy color, bright in the nose, subtle but prominent carbonation, mellow to medium tartness. An stunning beer that I could drink over and over again. Very similar to the Arctic Saison that they produce with Anchorage under the Grassroots banner.
Bottle. Hazy golden pour with a white head. Aromas of citrus, black pepper, and funk. Flavor is similar with an almost sour like quality to it. Very interesting and complex.

Bottle - Perfumy, grassy hops, sweet tropical fruits and pepper. Hazy gold with a decent white head. Lemon, orange, sweet with a bit of grass and a some pepper. Sweet candy orange lingers and makes it a bit juice like.

750 ml bottle to stemmed taster (shared by LitoIPA). Looks good; hazy pineapple with ample head. Smells yeasty, damp, and mildly hoppy. Tastes like it smells with some citrus zest on the tongue. Good beer.
Bottle from unknown. Pours a pale orange, little bit of off white head. Aroma some citrus, champagne yeast, dry. Body juicy and fluffy, with a crisp, dry finish.
Tap, gold pour, white head, nose is funky, taste is grassy, lemon, pepper, oranges

750ml bottle. Hazy blonde with a frothy white head. Flavors are bread, lemon and orange pith with spicy and grassy notes. Slight funk, light lactic sourness, nice tartness. Light body, moderate carbonation, slick texture.
Bottle at Borefts 2014. Pale gold white head. Lemon sherbert. Very good. Lovely lemon good body excellent finish. Superb.

Tap @ Mikkeller and Friends. Pours hazy light golden yellow with a medium fluffy white head. Aromas of citrus, spices, tart fruit, maybe some orange peel. Taste is tart fruit, lots of fresh citrus, spices, brett. Overall very fresh with a nice balanced tartness and spicyness.

15-OCT-2014, draft @Mikkeller & Friends.
Hazy, pale golden with a huge, lasting, lacing, very creamy White head.

Tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Fresh light smell of pears, apples and grapes. Pours pale yellow with a small white head. Tasteful beer with some sourness though fresh with a subtle nice after taste. Palate is thin, nice and enjoyable. Overall a nice beer which offers fresh fruits and citrus.

Draught. Hazy golden with an off white head. Apples, citrus a little pepper and barnyard in aroma. Tart with some apple sweetness in flavour. Light and fresh body with a little watery body. A vague bitter finish with some fruit. Thirst quencher of great dimensions, but it lacks depth in flavours.

Let syrlig mælkesyre duft. Næsten lambicagtig syrlighed i smag. Cremet rundhed men en hel ren maltkrop der giver mundfylde og giver plads til mælkesyren. Ingen humle men let bitterhed. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ mikkeller. Golden coloured. Hazy. Dense off White head. Aroma. Yeast, fruits, citrus, Spice. Flavour. Yeast, citrus, fruits some herbs. Medium to full bodied. Ends fruity and citric with a Light yeast touch.

Bottle to snifter. Nose is moderate citrus with mostly lemon and a light orange note. fairly clear light orange with a medium sized whitehead that dissipates fairly, leaving some lace on the glace. Taste is immediately lemon with some acidity, then opens up to show some grapefruit and orange. zesty. A light hop flavor it seems, some pepper. overall, very quenching, but the acidity is a bit much to make it gulpable, but it is still very drinkable.

Delicious. I love Arthur. The May batch is even better than the most recent batch. Holy crap. Tart, lemony beer with so much tartness and so much saisonnness. Really good. Adam hates my ratings. Im over it. Im sorry that Ive had too many but Im not stupid enough and certainly know that this beer is amaze-balls.
:)

Side by side tasting of bottled Anna, Florence & Arthur at BBF14. Props to Mike Morse. Thank you!
ANNA: plays on the light floral notes, but especially on the spicy and yeast compared to the other two. 4.1/5
FLORENCE: more zesty lemon with a drier body and a great dry finish, a real thirst quencher. 3.8/5
ARTHUR: fruitiest of the 3, with nice balanced pineapple notes and a tad of the yeasty saison chareter. 4.1/5

Bottle shared @ Borefts thanks to Mike. Hazy yellow with a pale head. Aroma is lemon zest, sour peach, apricot, funk, straw. Light bodied, tart on the palate, well balanced, long bretty finish. Taste is peach, lemon zest, sour candy, citrus

Had this at the 2014 RB Pittsburgh Summer Gathering at Horny Devils place. Actually it was after the equinox at the beginning of fall, but DILLIGAF. Big thanks to James & Michelle for hosting such a nice spread of quality beers and for this particular beer a GIANT thanks goes out to James. Slight odd off aroma, but I guess thats in a good way. Looks like lemonade, thin head that fades rapidly. Pretty good co2 bite on the tongue. Somewhat plastic background with a good tart overlay. For a saison, this is pretty good beer IMHO because its more like a wild ale, you knoe. Not like its saison in your face like so many others in the style. Yes, friendly, even at 6%.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text:
At BBF14 . 
Pours unclear yellow , OK white head . Smell is fruity , bit sour-funky . Grainy . 
Taste is bit bitter , some lemon , zesty .

A hazed golden saison with a thin white head. In aroma, sweet fruity malt with loads of Brett, orange pulp, catty notes, floral hops, beautiful. In mouth, a nice herbaceous malt, citrus pulp, light Brett, lemon juice, beautiful. #OttBottShare.
Yellow gold, hazy pour, nice white head. Aroma is lemon, banana, cloves, bread... sweet. Flavor is lemon, yeast, with bready, tart and herbal notes. Sharp flavor, nice body.

An excellent saison. Nicely sour with just a hint of funk. Very nice lemony aroma with a bit of sweetness. The taste has the lemon, a bit of funk and a nice hop balance. Very dry and refreshing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Clear pale yellow pour with a white head. Mild barnyard bouquet. Mild barnyard and lemon zest highlights. Some citrus notes. Not overly complex but still solid. Good body and mouthfeel
"Grassy and substantially more funky than most saisons-bordering on a sour. Hoppy bright citrus and musty aroma and flavor. Yet another hit from hill farmstead."
Bottle shared by Tom10101, thanks! Pours dark blnd with soapy white head. Aroma: amazing mix of citrus (grapefruits), hops, flower, yeast and rustic. Taste features a amazing lemony sourness.

750ml bottle from HF, split with friends. Pours a clear, light amber color with a big white head and some lacing. Aroma is malty, bread, wheat, some lemon citrus. Medium on the palate with creamy carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, bread, wheat, a little nutty, a little yeasty, with a sweet, malty finish. Very nice.

Bottle share. Small snifter. Pours a lazy hazy yellow with a frothy white head. Some small lacing. Aroma is light fruits, floral notes, funky yeasts, bread, hay, and slight pine. The taste is similar with the slight funky fruits on the front end and the benchmark hay and cereal backbone. Good carb, light and refreshing. Crisp finish with funk and some tartness. Very good saison!

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2014 Merci Simon! Franchement raffraichissante, le côté sûre est parfaitement balancé. Je ne pense pas être encore assez expérimenté pour arriver à détecter le côté "saison" de cette bière, je dois tout de même avouer! À laveugle, jaurais dit une gueuze sans hésiter.. La levure sauvage est définitivement présente et le côté citronné aussi. Malheureusement, il manque peut-être de cette complexité quarrivent à offrir certaines gueuzes mais bon, encore une fois, la Arthur na pas la prétention den être une! Bref, une très bonne bière!
Bottle, thanks to Jon for opening. Lemon, sour but not overly, slight pepper. Pretty good stuff, best sour saison Ive had.

Bottle.
Pours hazy golden with a firm white head.
Very tart for a saison, unclean in a good way.
Hazy yellow with a thick foam. Hay and grass aroma make this a true farmers beer. Strong dry hop flavors with lemon and grapefruit. Slightly tart finish. Best saison to date.

5/VII/14 - 75cl bottle @ RBBSG III (Gent) - BB: n/a, bottled: V/2014 (2014-734) Thanks to ThirstyBird for sharing the bottle!
Clear bright yellow beer, creamy white head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lots of orange peel, some cloves, very nasty and weird smell, yeasty. MF: too much carbon, medium to light body. Taste: pretty sour, lemony, artificial brett, bit funky, floral, yeasty. Aftertaste: orange peel, soft bitterness, bit sourish, floral, bit metallic, very dry, weird touch, lemony.

Bottle at Mikkeller & Friends, july 25th 2014. Hazy yellow body with a big lively white head. Funky aroma with grapefruit, lemon, thyme, wheat and white pepper. Taste is tart and funky, lots of fruit, kiwi and mango comes to mind, with orange zest and barnyard. Light spicy finish. Dry zesty and spicy aftertaste. A truly amazing beer, cheers to Arthur!

Bottle, thank you kind Lukaduke. Been 364 days since I enjoyed the one I smuggled home from the brewery -- gonna try to make this an annual treat for my birthday no matter what it takes! Almost impossible to find fault with this -- it looks beautiful, it smells amazing, it tastes incredible and it drinks like perfection. I dont have the vocabulary for the HF saisons, I just want to enjoy them and share my happiness. Cheers!

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2017 Bottled. Pours hazy golden with a huge, lacing white head. Aroma of caramel, funk, flovery and citrussy hops, yeast, pebber and some spice. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and a little bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and lively carbonation. An excellent and crisp Saison. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Draft @ Pony Bar. Pours a super cloudy yellow with a med white head. Aroma is floral, lemon lime mix, barnyard, wheat, light dank sock.. Glorious. Flavor is a lot of lemon lime tart, wheat, floral notes.. Tart on the finish. This stuff is glorious, nothing standout just perfectly balanced, drinkable, and refreshing. Super light mouthfeel, crisp and refreshing, lively Carini (autocorrect... Hilarious, meant carbo).

Bottle. Wow. Ok, this was my first HF beer and it was just awesome. Easily my favorite saison. Pours bright hazy yellow. Thick white dissipating head. Aroma is slightly pungent and acidic. Taste is fresh and puckering. Farmhouse funk and sour comes through. Tiny lacing bubbles on glass. Great beer.

Bottle. Aroma has some funkiness, lemon citrus, and some grassy notes. Appearance is bright gold, hazy, and has a big, pillowy white head. Great lacing. Taste is earthy up front, then is tart and refreshing, some yeasty notes, finishes nice and clean. Overall it is complex, refreshing, delicious. Outstanding beer.
750 ml. bottle. Thanks Mike!  Pours a hazy light gold with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, funk, and spice. Taste is lemon, tropical fruit, funk, spice, and floral. Very, very good.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2014 Bouteille 75cl @ RBBSG III, courtesy of Thirstybird.
Dorée léger trouble, col fin blanc.
Arôme est légèrement aigrelet avec un rappel typique de brett et un houblonné laissant des effluves de citronné en rétro-nasal.
Palais offre un profil aigrelet tirant fortement sur le citronné accompagné de malts pâles. Ressemblance de saison se marque plus dans lapproche de la levure. Je ne retrouve pas le côté rustique de cette dernière. Le brett, qui je ne sais pas ce quil vient faire ici, gâche un peu le but de cette saison. Retrouve une dominance plus marquée des houblons américains qui apporte plus de fraîcheur. Reste cependant une belle découverte.
Bottle @ RBBSG, 2014. Thanks thirstybird! Yellow cloudy colour, some white foam. Medium carbonation. Nose of citrus. Sour and juicy. Light sweet, refreshing, easy drinkable. Well balanced. Very good!

750 ml. bottle sampled @ RBBSG III. Thanks to thirstybird! Fizzy citrus golden. Smells like fizzy lemonade, touch artificial citrus with brett. Taste is sour lemonade, brett, artificial lemon, effervescent & quite fizzy, lemon, lightly floral. Not bad at all but I did expect a lot more from a HF saison, a bit to lemonade-like for me I suppose.

Bottle shared by Tony. Pours hazy pale yellow color with white head. Aromas of lemon and funk with some grassy hops. Tart lemon and wheat flavors with some grassy hops and a hint of yeast. Light to medium body with lively carbonation and a dry finish. Excellent.

75 cl bottle @ home. Batch 01/2014
Lots of foam when pouring. Aroma has citrus, funky yeasty notes and some bretta. Flavour has citrus, grapefruit, white wine . Finishes with some green apples. A saison on the tart side.

The last drops of the bottle felt lactic, most likely because of yeast. So  keep your yeast in the bottle.

Bottle with major thanks to Bacterial. Pours gold with steadily streaming bubbles replenishing a dense white head. Lovely lacing. Aroma: lemon drop, hay. This feels soft and gentle. Nose hints at mineral and pepper, but neither is really a major feature. Grass, hay, bread, and the feeling that this is going to be sour. Taste: lemon drop again, sweet citrus up front that gives way to mineral, somewhat tart finish. Not tremendously dry. The creamy mouthfeel and softness of carbonation reminds me of sherbet or lemon sorbet. Overall: this is a lovely beer. Its hard to say how much knowing its HF and knowing its the first time Ive had a normal sized pour of their beers affects things -- I definitely went into this with a mindset to give it extra close consideration, and the expectation I would be amazed. That probably isnt fair. I like this, its a nice saison, and perhaps that should be enough.

Chris generously shared this beer that has been right up at the tip top of my want-to-try list. Pineapple-juice colored hazy pour with a fluffy if short-lived white head. Pungent funk and lemon drive the aroma, I like Chriss "lemon drop" descriptor; given the aroma I expect this to be tart but not particularly dry. It is indeed gently tart and not particularly dry. Lemon. Bread. A saison in the Fantome / Jolly Pumpkin vein (appropriately; these are tonights pairings) rather than Dupont let alone the usual American saison esters. The funk recalls a mild camembert. Just a hint of grassy hops closing out the flavor very late. Very softly carbonated, almost creamy, very full body.
