---AJ's Approval

Thanks to ACD. Wow. Appearance: golden orange: small white head. Aroma: wow, I dont even know where to start. Sweet, hoppy, sour, floral, so hoppy, spicy, fruity as hell, just phenomenal. Flavour: Sour, sweet, floral, hoppy, spicy, yeasty, dry, citra, lovely long bitter finish. Delightful.
Bottle. Pale golden with white head. Aroma of dusty citrus lemon, light pepperyness. Taste of peppery lemon, sherbet lemon, sharp and citrusy. Dry and lightly tart. Very nice indeed

Very pale, cloudy light golden. Ringed white fluff and film. Terse ivory plinkle of lemon. Buried sherbert, hay, so clean and lean. A strong and lasting Saison yeasty safe buzz. Crinklely mouthfeel when the carbonation fades. Finishes a little chalky/soapy is the only downside. Linger is dragging lemon, softest and cleanest yeast. Much, much delicious. Bottle, Cheers BenH, Alps Tasting
Bottle at Craigs. Pours hazy golden, tart, refreshing lemon, sweet, dry, yeasty.

Bouteille rapportée de la brasserie au Vermont.
Lolfactif nous dévoile des accents prononcés de levure aux notes de pommes et de cidre ainsi que des houblons floraux et herbacés.
Le visuel est jaune / paille, flou, avec une bonne mousse dense qui tient bien et qui laisse de belles traces sur le verre.
En bouche, les levures sauvages prennent immédiatement le dessus, développant des notes de pommes et laissant une douce acidité agir en permanence. Lacidité est très agréable malgré tout. Elle demeure très rafraichissante. La texture est assez mince. Léquilibre est bon. Mais jen suis un peu déçu de par son manque de complexité.
75 cl bottle @ home. Pours hazy golden with a little sediment and a white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are yeast, spices, and fruit - with a slightly dry finish.
750 ml bottle shared by Jeff. A fantastic funky and genuine saison made in the rustic Belgian style. A gem of a beer. Thx for sharing Jeff!
Bottle. Starts out nice and fruity with notes of watermelon and tangerine. A rough and rather unpleasant citrusy sourness takes over after a while. Too bad as this beer seemd very promising.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2014 Bottle. Hazy gold with a fluffy white head. Aroma is saison yeast and citrus. Taste is lightly tart with some lactic notes and tangerine. Nice mineral aspect as well. Beautiful soft mouthfeel with sufficient carb. Incredible.

Bottle shared by AdamJackson, thanks for the opportunity!
Cloudy deep straw color with a decent sized white head that dissipates slowly. Aromas of tart funky lemony light sugary malt. Flavor is tart citrus with hints of funkiness and bits of earthy earthiness to round it all out. Really nice funkified farmhouse ale.
Hazy light yellow pour with a nice white head. Funky and slightly sour nose. Really nice taste - right at the intersection of sour, funky and hoppy. Excellent.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2015 Bottle. Pours light hazy yellow, fizzy. Tiny white head. Aroma is yeast, fresh herbs, spicy. Taste is light sweet, sharp and citrusy. Bitter and lasting spicy finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ home. Hazy yellow, big white head that last, great lacing. Aroma, malty, sour, lime, lemon, grass, peber. Similar taste. Slightly oily mouth feel. Bitter sour aftertaste, with lime, peber, malt.

750ml bottle (May 2014 batch) shared thanks to Lukaduke! Pours hazy golden yellow with a finger of head. Nose is bright rustic earthy dry yeast, tart citrus, lemon. Taste is sour citrus, lemon, lime, dry subtle fruity yeast, touch of cereal. Finish is dry sour fruity lemon, citrus, rustic grains, soft malt touches. Awesome!

75cl bottle. Hazy gold, big white head. Loads of tangerine, white grape and light melon on the nose with a bit of spicy yeast. Big tangerine on tasting, grape and more tropical fruit. Drying spicy yeast, pithier citrus. Grapefruit comes in there. Dry finish. Class

Bottle; Pour is fairly clear, light gold, with a frothy fine bubbled white head into this glass. Retention is average, with sticky lacing presence here as well. The nose is stunning on this one - Its the highlight though - the bar is so high that I find the rest of it to be disappointing in a way. Its the perfect fusion of malted barley, lemongrass, modest barnyard notes, mineral water, with a touch of peppery spice. The flavor profile takes a little adjustment - the citrus funk is striking for the style. With time though - a stunning spring saison. Spent grain, lemon zest, grassy hops, light florals, a robust mouthfeel, with a striking modest funk finishline. It was different than I predicted, but as awesome as I had hoped.

Bottle shared with ktwse, kryon79 and two others at Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade, May 1st. Pours a pale hazy yellow with a large frothy white head. Aroma of grapefruit, kiwi, funk, lemongrass, slight coriander, sage. Taste is grapefruit, kiwi, funk, coriander, sage, honey, lemongrass. Mouthfeel is sprightly with high carbonation. Aftertaste is funk, citrus, lemongrass. Quite the exceptional saison!

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2016 Bottle at a street in Copenhagen... Golden hazy amber... Small white head... Soft zezty floral orange fruit nose... Juicy fruits... Juicy orange fruit... Massive clementine (courtesy of Nate) soft sweet fruits... Juicy floral orange... Dry zezty orange salty fruits 

 bottle at home june 2014 ... light hazy yellow ... thin white lacing ... sofft light floral salty orange nose ... ... massive fruits ,, juicy soft and zezty

Tap at war pigs.. Golden amber... Thin white lacing.. Soft zesty floral fruit nose.. Soft dry fruit.. Light peach.. Light lime.. Soft sweet floral fruit 3.6

Pours hazy golden yellow with tall white head. Aroma is very fresh with tons of herbs, thyme, basil, sage, coriander and lemongrass, honey and wheat. Taste is tart sour, fresh and crisp with lingering baking soda finish. Body is light and crisp with soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Arthur a toujours été un prénom que je déteste, malgré Arthur Laroche, ici ce Arthur, je ne le déteste pas au contraire. Il est fort agréable avec ces notes citronnées amalgamé à du foin aigre. En bouche il se laisse boire, un bon mélange aigre et sucré avec tout ce citron.

Pours hazy golden high white head
Aromas of barnyard, citrus, hay, garden spices
Taste has citrus, garden spices, hints of caramel, slight sour fruits

Bottle, courtesy Michael, thanks! Pours gold, white head. Good retention/some lace. Aroma is grain, grassy, ester, citrus. Taste is lightly tart, lightly bitter, lemon, grassy, grain. Palate is dry, effervescent, light bitter finish. Another classic HF saison.

Cette Saison est jaune et sa tête blanche est bien accrochée. Sa dentelle prend un malin plaisir à décorer la paroi de mon verre. Son nez plein de paille laisse aussi passer des notes fruitées aigres, du poivre blanc et des arômes de cornichons à laneth. Ses saveurs sont délicates. Je découvre des pommes, du citron, des épices, de la levure sauvage affûtée et des notes de vinaigre. Au palais, jai la sensation dun corps de moyenne densité avec un pétillement bas et une texture crémeuse. En finale, des notes acides se manifestent et deviennent, au fil des gorgées, un peu agressives. Une Saison qui est loin dêtre mauvaise mais qui est aussi loin dêtre impressionnante.
Pours a cloudy light yellow with a fizzy white head. Aroma funky, yeasty, and bready; a lot going on. Lemon peel sourness, with a flavor like chewing a stalk of hay. Finishes bright and effervescent.

Early in the day at HMOG 2014. Long slow gusher attests to the carbonation and hints at the dryness you get with this one. Lots of bubbles adding to the texture of the drink. Funky earthy wild aroma is really nice. Smooth light and toasty grain flavors. Grassy herbal hop flavors with a touch of toasted wheat. Herbal tea flavors as well wtih a little bit of pepper spice.
HMOG 2014. Thanks jrob21. Light hay, mellow lemon, grassy, light refreshing tart, a bit of funk and spice. Real refreshing, highly carbed. It was one of those slow gushers. Awesome stuff.
Beautiful cloudy yellow color, effervescent yet nearly opaque. A bit rustic in the nose, with the palate lending to a more tart lemony and yeasty character. Another excellent HF saison offering.
Pours a beautiful hay color with a decent white head. Smells like a bouquet of lemons and yeast. Tastes glorious! So yeasty and sour. Brett isn't overpowering, but is a very nice addition.
Bottle from James. Pours a cloudy gold with white head and decent lace. Aroma of lemon, citrus, grain. Medium body, nice dry finish

Bottle at the Triad bottle share at Foothills organized by Mike. Hazy pale gold pour. Nice blend of both citrus juiciness and bready notes in the nose. Lovely flavor with soft but juicy pineapple and orange rind balance by rye bread and coriander. Full and almost frothy mouthfeel despite being thin and crisp. Yeasty finish. Refined, delicate, tried and true Hill Farmstead. Really good.

Bottle thanks to Seth. Pours a cloudy orange with medium frothy white head that lasts leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is strong citrus, lemon zest, yeast, and brett. Medium mouthfeel with strong yeast, light citrus, with lingering brett flavor. Refreshing and easy to drink, very impressive.
Bottle. Golden pour with white head. Spice, yeast, tropical fruit aromas. Flavor is super fresh with Brett, fruit and nice complexity.

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2014 Majestueuse robe dorée orangée qui éjecte à son sommet une mousse onctueuse. Le nez est celui dun pain frais tartiné dun gâteau de levure et saupoudré dun zest dorange. Le corps est bien effervescent et se métamorphose plus avance la dégustation, cest presque juteux vers la fin. Le liquide traverse délicatement un brouillard de houblons vers une finale légèrement herbacée.

This one poured a hazy yellow color wirth a white head. Aroma was of grass, hay, lemons, earth, and rain. Flavor was grainy and citrsuy, some vbread, light rusitic funkyness. Anogther solid saison from HF.

Its my name! Bottle shared thanks to beerman6686. Pours a hazy yellow with a fluffy white head. Leaves a beautiful lacing. Aroma of slight Brett but not too crazy. Slight pineapple. Taste is dry and slightly tart. Effervescent. Delicious.

750ml bottle poured into a tulip:. Hazy straw colored with a very thick, foamy, white head. Aroma is lemon, hay, brett, and funk. Taste is a bit citrusy, pepper, and definitely a brett yeast element but its not overpowering (which I enjoy). Medium body, a bit bitter from the brett, nice beer.

The 750mL pours with a murky sort of hazy gold body that supports a white head. The aroma offers up sugary sweetness, spicy Saison like yeasty notes, plenty of flowery wet meadow and mild fruity esters. Smells pretty rich. The taste confirms this as it is on the sweet sluggish side for a Saison with sugary sweetness, apples and pear sweet fruity esters rimmed with a fruit skin like tartness and then yeasty spices. It picks up lots of floral and flowery notes as well as a touch of funky basement mustiness mixed tartness toward the finish. Overall too heavy and too sweet.
Bottle @ De Molen, thanks JulienHuxley! Aroma is peppery yeast, brett, fruits, lemon, some malt. Flavour is a quite dry zesty bretty fruity peppery yeast, citric bretty finish. Very refreshing!

750ml bottle shared by Madbeerbaron. Thick, unfiltered yellow-tan. Foamy, lacy white head. Lemony, sour, dry chardonnay tastes. Nice, subtle, refined. Pretty much nails it. Dry peppery, fruity tropical undertones. True.

Poured slowly out of a bottle courtesy of Adam Jackson. Cheers! Aroma is of a light Brett funk, citrus, some hay. Appearance is sparkling golden, fine carbonation, almost champagne-like. Taste tart for a Saison. Full flavored. Nice medium bodied compliments the sweet barley, light hop bitterness and hints of bready yeast. Very nice balance of flavors. Finishes very crisp.

Bottle. Thanks Mike! Medium hold body, white head. Nose is some pithy citrus, strawberries, yeast. Flavor is citrus, unbalanced tartness, a bit of harsh yeast. Its a fine bet but doesnt compare with most of hills other offerings.

I love this beer. Poured from the bottle. Beautiful orange color and a great funky Brett nose. This surprising saison hits you from the start - spice, sour, wow. Great palate and a lovely finish. A great drinker all around.

Batch and Bottle: unk

Pours a diaphanous gold ale with a finger of white foam that falls over a few minutes to a broken sheet of the same. spotty lace. Smells of funk, grass, hay, must, manure and hints of herbal yeast. Nice nose. Slightly bitter initially, this converges with flavors of lemon, amaretto, pear and the slightest cloves. Some dirty character to the whole thing. Decent flavor, its oddly crisp with the components. Mouthfeel is light with hi carb and a snappy finish. 

This is a "rustic farmhouse saison". Yep, I agree with that assessment. Nice beer.

Serving type: bottle

02-09-2012

Rating #900!. 75cl bottle.
APPEARANCE: light clouded blond beer, nice stable white head.
NOSE: little peppery, fruity, nice!
TASTE: nice balanced sourness, fruity, full aftertaste, nice alcohol hint. Very good saison! Again a great Hill Farmstead beer I had the pleasure of enjoying!
Bottle. Pours a straw yellow with a foamy head. Slightly sour with good carbonation and earthy tones. Saisons arent my favorite style, but this one was decent.

Tap at Capones Annual Black Friday event, Norristown PA, 29/11/13.
Clear golden with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is tarte fruit skins, citric dipped straw, burnt lemon rind, cobwebs, grass, soured grapes, light funk.
Taste comprises bitter orange, earthy, farmyard, citric dipped straw, tarte lemon rind, grape skins, dank light balsa wood tones.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, crisp finale. 
Clean and refreshing saison.
Good work as usual from HF.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Big thanks to Corey for sending me this! Very cloudy golden pour with a frothy white head that sits atop and nice lace. Very rustic aroma, bubblegum, hints of phenolic spice, light starchy wheat, grassy, touches if yeast and citrus. A touch sweeter and smooth body with lemon, grassiness, yeast with grains and a funky end. Medium bodied with nice carbonation. Very interesting and different Saison. Great stuff.

Thanksgiving to rbrazell! Hazy straw yellow with white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast wheat and grass. Effervescent with lemon grass and wheat notes. Extremely drinkable and worth seeking out. More please!

Bottle shared thanks to rbrazell! Pours a hazy golden yellow with fluffy white head and good lacing. Aroma is funky yeast, tart lemon, hint of grass. Taste is more of the citrus and less of the grass, good woody funk. Nicely done saison.

Fresh bottle. Gorgeous nose of clove, heavy floral, light yeasty esters, lemon. Hazy lemon in color with a big fluffy head. Delightful taste of tart lemon, sweet orange, a light grassy tone, light lactic acid, and slight spicy coriander. Light, refreshing body. Awesome Saison.

Thanks to Dustin for this one. 750 mL to tulip glass. Carbonation is... enthusiastic. I didnt serve it super cold but still, the foam started to creep out of the bottle and each pour was a time-consuming affair. Aroma is a soft lemon verbena with fresh hay. Flavor is a little sharper than that, with the lemony character turning both slightly acidic and slightly rindy. Honeyed malt and a Brett finish with a bit of phenolics and more dusty straw. Very enjoyable saison.

A: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head, Decent Lacing

S: Yeasty, Peppercorn, Lemons

T: Lemons, Yeasty, White Pepper

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Bitter

Overall, a nice mildly bitter saison, good spicy blend.

Bottle from box aroma offered courtesy of Edmund Edmunds xochitl bro 2 the end of life. 






Pours a hazy yellow with a good head and nice lacing on the glass.

The bottle from box aroma on this one is pretty solid... lemony, sort of lightly funky with lots of hay, grass, and dusty malt offered. Some leafy hops work well in the mix as well. As it warms it opens up and there is some distinct barnyard earthiness. 

The beer is nicely bitter & earthy with some leafy hop character. Its perfectly dry & tart with some lemony sour notes... as the glass progresses there is a nice little lime-stoney note. The beer is extraordinarily drinkable, very well balanced and finessed. 

Palate is that classic high carbonation prickly Saison thing. 

Cool beer bro
Not a shelf beer
xochitl

Flaske: Fornem lysegul uklar øl. Duft af let syre med en klassisk saison base. Masser af kompleksitet og masser af dejlig smag. Virkelig en forfriske tørstslukker der stadig er forbandet nuanceret. Et lille mesterstykke.

Bottle, as pictured. Pours a hazy golden yellow. Has a smell of orange, very pungent citrus with a little bit of flowery scent. It has the distinctive Hill Farm champagne-ish tart yeast flavor, and taste is similar to the scent. Very good, as always.

4-13 Batch, reviewed live 8/14/13. Bottle had a slow gush upon opening, poured into a HF wine glass. 

A- Pours a hazy orange -yellow color with a soapy white head that fills the top three inches of my glass. As it slowly fades to about a third of an inch, it leaves insane lacing on all sides of the glass. Carbonation is noticeable, and appears fairly high, though alright for style. 

S- Brett straight up. It rears its head with lemon, orange peel, pepper, and some complimentary band aid phenolics. 

T- Awesome tartness that you wouldnt have expected from the smell. Tons of lemon mixed with a little bit of grassy flavors, as well as some spicy notes to balance the whole thing out. Pretty much the perfect saison as far as flavors goes, but that is just one mans opinion. Decent bitterness at the end as well, it plays well with the pepper notes on the back end. 

M- Prickly carbonation, medium to low body with a crisp finish that sports some decent drying, although nothing that isnt tolerable, or enjoyable for this style. 

O- God- the last time I had this same batch it didnt blow me away. This time around, it is clear that the bugs have taken over and just bumped this beer up in to the top tier. The lemon adds a tartness that is very well balanced by the pepper phenols and bitter hop notes at the end of the taste. The high carbonation and drying effects make you crave another sip, and the appearance is as close to perfect for a saison as one could ask. Give me more please....

Pours cloudy light straw with a big fluffy white head interspersed with chunks of air. Amazing retention and lacing.

Light lemon aromas. Wheat, a bit of yeast and some must. Maybe some coriander, but nice and light on the spices.

Lots of lemon flavor up front. Good tartness through the middle mixed with a little funk and tangy wheat. Finishes with lemon zest and an almost white wine like component. Light pepper and coriander although thankfully the spice component is toned down.

Light bodied. Carbonation is high accentuating the tartness. Wonderful creamy mouthfeel that is typical of HF beer.

Very easy drinking beer. Just the right amount of tartness to keep me wanting more, but not to overwhelm the palate. I hate most saisons, but whatever HF does with them is gold because this is another winner.

22 oz. bottle served in a Deschutes snifter. Thanks to pmoney for the share.

A: Pours a hazy yellow color with a huge dollop of white foam forming on the pour. It recedes slowly to a thick cap that leaves some stick lace down the glass.

S: Stone fruit and light yeasty notes with some lemony background scents. Grassy as well with a sweet malt profile.

T: Same as the nose with a tad more sweetness from the malts. Sweet bread with stone fruit and some spiced yeast. A little dry with some lemon tartness and mild dried grass.

M: Light bodied with a medium high carbonation. Bubbly texture across the tongue with a sweet and yeasty finish.

O: Another nice saison from HF. Hits all the balances of yeast, fruit and malt.

Serving type: bottle

05-24-2013

24 karat pour with a vibrant ivory cap that left significant rings of lacing as it traveled down the glass. Pungent lemon zest, tart grapefruit rind, and mild pepper accompany freshly baked buttermilk biscuits in the nose. Flavor shows the same bright citrus but also has a nice earthiness, acidity, and funk to add complexity. Refreshing and flavorful. Ample carbonation to ignite the palate. Wish I could get this locally...an every day drinker for sure!

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with a good eggshell white head. Smell is bread; citrus, funky tart lemon rind and a little wet hay. Taste is tart lemon citrus, mild hops, wheat bread and overall funky tart beer. Light refreshing, highly carbonated smooth saison.

Courtesy of tectactoe
Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate-heavy citrus, tart lemon/lime, and sweet tarts. It pours a hazy dull yellow with a one finger white head that quickly fades to a thin film outlined by a thicker ring. The flavor starts with a quick dose of citrus. The finish has moderate floral notes, light lemon/lime peel, and some faint grassy bitterness. Its light-medium bodied with mild carbonation.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2014 Bottle: Mild gush, hazy pale yellow body with a soapy, quickly receding stark white head. Aroma is fresh grass, lemon zest, mild hops, a touch of farmhouse yeasty tartness. Taste is light and refreshing, zesty lemon-lime, a hint of tartness, grassy, leafy hops, a mild blanket-like yeasty funk, finishing dryness with a fading lemon and orange tartness. Smooth, refreshing, quenching saison.

Draught in Burlington, VT. Pours a hazy yellow with decent head. Smells of citrusy lemon and earthy grass. Strong bitterness on the tongue complemented by the citrus. Light, refreshing and crisp. My girlfriend enjoyed her sip and she doesnt even like beer. Awesome.
750 at my place with group. Pours orange. Aroma is orange lemon citrus. Taste is citrus orange barnyard, a slight tart bite. Finish is quick and funky. Mouthfeel is lighter.

Bottle via international trade; Cloudy orange pour with frothy white head, floral aroma, apple taste with honey a hint of citrus powdery yeast action, minerals, satsuma, amazing stuff, this is the best saison Ive had amazing stuff.

Bottle atNørrebro Bryghus, June 5th. Hazy golden witha big and lasting white head. Big perfumed floral and complex spicy aroma with pepper and vanilla dominating.Dry and tart fruity flavour with lots of citrus, some spicyand some wooden notes. Drinkable, complex and very satisfying

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2013 750mL bottle during RBWG 2013. Golden pour with a nice off-white head, lots of lacing. Earthy, musty, a bit of phenolics in the aroma, some wood and a touch of funk, lemon, cedar, and grassiness. Not bad.

Snagged by my homie Nick at the anniversary fest. Thanks man! 750 poured into HF stemware. Clear piss yellow pour with a moderate white head that leave lacing and a slight film. Smell is lemon and juicy citrus with a slight barnyard funk. Taste is insanely refreshing, lemon, peppery spice, little funky hay. Carbonation is perfect and lights up the palette. Followed by a clean dry finish. I have had Arthur a few times before, and i think this batch outshines the last few i have had. I honestly dont think I could be drinking a more perfect beer for this July afternoon.
Shared with timfoolery. Had this after Anna. A little more sour and a little less sweet with some slightly different earthy characteristics. Very good.

750mL bottle shared by Tim courtesy of zharsch. Appearance is thick light gold in color, solid looking, no clarity with a thick-ass head and thick lacing. Very frothy and cloudy head. Aroma is very cleaned up yet powerful Belgian yeast with spiky sharp pear, hints of apple. Flavor is similarly sharp esters, bitter peach and pear with the hops playing a bigger role. Its a very great way to tame a powerful yeast and make it very appealing without the over the top aspects. But in a way I miss the crazy characteristics.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Bottle shared by madbeerbaron...thanks Ben! - Pours hazy pale yellow with a thick foamy white head. Nose is peppery and dry with some pear and pale malt. Taste is the same, with lots of pear, a little spiciness, and a bit of soapiness. Real crisp and fruity--very quenching. Smooth and soft, with nice fluffy carbonation.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2013 750ml bottle. Highly effervescent, pop of the cork, slowly over-flowing the lip. Tall, thick, lasting white head atop a cloudy gold body. Lots of band aid / glue in the nose.  Brie / goat cheese / curds, somewhat buttery but that blows off after a short time. Hints of sweetness in the approach are washed away by high acid and effervescent carbonation, leaving a waxy and oily coating in a dry and bitter finish. Theres some tropical phenols that linger, and some higher alcohols, but I find myself overly sensitive to and what I get is pretty mild. I would probably guess that the alcohol has creeped over 7% in this bottle, its very dry, theres some very light fusel blowoff. Tropical, gummi but not sweet, phenolic, waxy, estery, musty. Very brett-y character. Its certainly lively, and I can appreciate the effort, though I am not so keen on this mustiness these days.  So now I wonder how much oak is in this?  I have read that releases of Arthur will approach Art, meaning a portion is barrel aged a.l.a solera process (???), and that would explain the brett inoculation as well as the neutral oak / vanillin / dill / coconut smell.

Bottle from HF trade. No honey profile like Anna. Aroma and flavor shifted toward the sour aspect of the wild yeast, but, yes, rustic. Very good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 ounce bottle from Timfoolery, acidic on the tongue, not much blanket, pale yellow. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I guess its overkill to say this is great - its Hill Farmstead. Pours dark cloudy yellow lace with good lacing and head. Aroma of bretta, orange peel and a little cumin and pepper even. Finishes bitter-sour. Soft carbonation. Thanks to John for sharing this.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2015 Terrific saison. Aroma is tantalizing with a fruit invitation. Cloudy yellow. Understated carbonation. Some lace. Slightly pickled lemon taste and thats a good thing. Very good drinkability. Lots of farmhouse .just as giod in the end of the bottle. Thanks for sharing Sprague.had again 2 years later.
Bottle. Gotta love the funk! This was very tasty, and was very fortunate to meet people who just picked these up from the brewery while in line on Only Void Day.

From Brad. Thanks! Split. Reviewed from notes. 

A: Pours out as a yellow-lemon sun with an energetic and expanding white head. Great head retention. 

N: Lemon zest and pine/cedar. Forest floors, dried leaves, and log cabins. Lavender and coriander seeds. Green apple. Have to give this one high marks; I really enjoy it. 

T: Slightly soured with some bitterness and very little malt. Clean taste for the most part, but then I get a hint of sharp, stomach acid which I really cant stand. 

M: dry and pleasing. The beer fills the palate, and then it disappears. 

O: This is really nice, but I really wish it didnt have that stomach acid effect because its a huge turnoff for me. If not for that one flaw, this might be my perfect beer.

750 ml bottle from Secret Santa. Thanks man! Pours a bright orange color with a big, thick white head. Aroma of barnyard funk, rich dough and bread, basement aromas, mild clove and pineapple. Flavor is dusty and bread notes in the forefront, dry, rich, and funky. The finish brings out a splash of citrus and tropical fruits. Absolutely delicious. Nice, medium body, full carbonation. This is a fantastic beer.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 750ml bottle in a Hill Farmstead glass. Pours cloudy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of light fruits, spiciness, caramel and pale malts, and light floral hops. Flavor the same with a nice blend of everything. Average texture. A great saison. Edit: The latest batch.  Still looks the same.  Tart flavor in addition to everything I mentioned before.  Another great HF beer.  EDIT: 750ml bottle Dry Hopped batch 2 (purchased March 2016). Not as good as regular Arthur.  I feel like the hops take away from the clean, crisp finish.

25.4 oz bottle courtesy of zharsch, shared with beastiefan2k and csbosox. The pour is a hazy orange golden yellow, with a smallish white head. Nice lace left behind on the glass. The aroma is soft lemon citrus, dry floral, a bit of yeast funk, and a very pleasant mineral earth encompassing the entire nose. The taste is tart lemon citrus, with floral character, opening up to the dry funk yeast earth and mineral. The palate is lovely, medium to light bodied, soft natural carbonation, and a dry tart funk mineral finish. Nice one, cheers for sharing Zach.

Bottle sample at a sour tasting at Noams office. Thanks Ariel. Pours an hazy yellow with a nice head, aroma of brett, green leaves and herbs, flavor is sour with lemon, herbs, green tea, bitter, dry with noticeable carbonation, medium bodied

Bottle, thnx to Bytemesis, shared at Deans Sticky Floor Tasting 2. Big gusher, bottle almost exploded, luckily my superhuman reflexes did not allow much beer to be spoiled. Hazy blonde pour with a soapy, fluffy white head. Aroma is funky barnyard saison yeast with some light touches of Brett. Flavor is medium sour and light spicey. Low abv, yet nice full flavour. Mouthfeel is well rounded, no sharp edges and a dry, yet juicy finish. Very good.

750 mL bottle via Lubiere, cool, tulip. Gushed. Milky golden with a large, fluffy white head. Quite peppery, spicy, zippy, green herbs, light funky tang, a little booze, nice. Medium-ish body, very low effervescence. Nice peppery character, a little green herb, light funk, a bit of toasted grain, nice; dry, gentle bitterness and a green, lightly funky finish. Pretty good.
750ml bottle pours a straw yellow with a frothy white head. Herbal lemon lime aroma. Lemon yeast and a slight bitter after taste.

Bottle @ Sticky floor tasting II. Opaque hazy yellow, a bit pale yellow color even with a small to medium sized white head. Smell and taste lightly malts, a touch of sour, lightly funk, orangepeel and citrussy. Quite fresh and nice. Quite like it.
Bottle shared @ Deans Sticky Floor Tasting II. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Yeasty, but slightly sour aroma. Lovely weizen-like mouth feel with a sour finish

Bottle at Deans sticky floor tasting.  Pours hazy yellow with a huge white head. Smells funky, barnyard and citrusy. Taste is well rounded with typical saison flavour. Very nice and balanced. Some brett aswell.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2016 Bottle shared at Deans sticky floor tasting 2 thanks to Mrhangover.  Pours cloudy yellow with a white head.  Aroma of saison yeast, lemon peel, light grapefruit.  Flavour is light moderate sweet, light bitter.  Medium bodied with soft carbonation.  Very nice example of the style.

66cl bottle courtesy of MrHangover @DSFT2.
Thick creamy white head.  Pale golden blond pour.  A very nice saison.

Bottle shared at a sour tasting at Noams office. Cloudy yellow with a huge white head. Aroma of fruits, flowers, some funk and earthy notes. Dry flavor with light tartness, fruits and a bitter and slightly astringent finish with citric notes. Medium-bodied, lively carbonation. Refreshing.

Aroma: lots of lemon, light malt, grapefruit, some fruity Brett notes, a touch of funk, pepper.  Appearance: light golden with a slight haze, fluffy white head had good retention and leaves wisps of lacing.  Taste: good dose of acidity, bright and refreshing, lemon zest, hints of pineapple and grapefruit, light malt notes, medium bitterness, bone dry finish.  Palate: light-medium body, medium+ carbonation, dry and refreshing finish. Overall: really great saison, crisp and dry with lots of fruit and Brett character.

(Sample @ Nørrebro Bryghus Tasting) Pours a slightly hazy golden with little, white head. Decent retention, good lace and little regeneration. Aroma is spicy, peppery saison yeast with funky hints resemblant of cider something lactic. Oily texture, medium carbonation and a very dry finish. Flavour is somewhat tart and cidery.

Bottle bought at Mikkeller & Friends in April 2013.

Hazy yellow with a large white head. Very nice beer this one, balanced and smooth. Spices, lemon, wood, yeast and funk. Fresh and very refreshing.

Bouteille 750ml, courtoisie de mathieuc. De couleur dorée-jaune et quasi-opaque. Nez de levures fruitées (agrumes acides, notes de pêches), moyennement épicées (poivre doux), rustiques et aux notes sauvages, moyen de houblon floral, légèrement herbeux et aux notes citriques (citronnées), moyen de céréales avec des notes de pain. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture légèrement crémeuse et aux notes croustillantes. Goût légèrement sûr et acide de levures fruitées rustiques (agrumes, surtout de citron, traces de pêches), moyen-léger épicées (poivre doux, traces de coriandre) et aux notes sauvages lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de céréales fraîches avec un léger goût de pain. Parallèlement, lon retrouve une légère amertume asséchante de houblon floral, herbeux et aux notes citriques (citronnées) jusquen finale. Post-goût moyen et moyennement sec, composé dun goût de levures fruitées légèrement acides (citron et zeste) aux notes épicées avec une légère amertume de houblon herbeux aux notes florales.

@basunen: vilken härlig blandning av frukt, krydda och syrlighet. Fantastisk fin blandning med en härlig balans. Mmmmmm

November 2, 2012 - with blankboy, gregclow, jercraigs & mabel - 750ml capped bottle c/o blankboy.  Very cloudy pale yellow with a huge lasting fluffy white head.  Lovely aroma - dry, lemony/yeasty, floral, acidic/funky - gooood.  Taste - oooh! - more like a sour ale than anything else "lemon ......... and stuff" - not much alcohol presence.  Average body, nice and acidic, solid carbonation, dry tingly battery acid finish - not over the top, lemon zest in the finish.

Bottle. Pours hazy pale golden with airy white head. Clear aroma of hops with subtle acidic and grainy notes. Bitter, hoppy flavour with vinous notes and subtle, sweet grainy touches. Bready aftertaste. Good.

Bottle. Pours a clear light golden color with a light white head. Very nice aroma, yeast easters along with a funky note. Medium/light mouthfeel. Sweet with a sourness as well, hop bitter notes, some green apple. Tatsy

On tap at the Railroad bar and grill.  Pours a dark cocoa brown with light brown head.  Chocolatey aroma, also very cocoa (a theme to be sure).  Mouthfeel is moderate but actually a little thick for a porter.  Slightly greasy and more towards an export stout as its not quite thin or dry enough to be a porter.  Taste is cocoa to be sure.  The Belgian notes were quite present.  Reminded me of a smaller Weyerbacher Tiny, except good.  The more I drank, the more I liked.

Bouteille de 750 ml partagée lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal. Arôme: Odeur de citron avec une pointe de lime et de poivre. Apparence: La couleur est blonde opaque. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de citron avec une pointe de dépices et de fleurs. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de citron en arrière goût. (Rating #4793)

Big bottle shared thx to Torsten at Mikkeller bar cons 2013-05-04 Cophenhagen
AR: bretty, grape fruit, citrus
AP: wee hazy golden, high frothy cream colored head
F: citric, lemon zest, tropical fruits, white peppery, tart, fresh mandarine

S: Blows out whith lots of grains and farm bretty notes, there is also lemons with sharp smell (pee) which was unpleasent and really one of few things I didnt enjoy about this beer, but it fades after a while, and then just add some spices to the smell. Strong smell overall. P: A golden haze with a big white haze, this looks like mango juice towards the end. T: I found this rather difficult, there is banyard tartness upfront, sour lemons, coriande, and some spices, its just great. M:Light and puckery with great carbonation. O: A great fine saison, the lemons and spices made this awsome, I was sad driking the last drops.

Bottle at Mikkeller & Friends. I remember when I had my first saison, it was a Fantome quite long ago. I was blown away be it´s blance and complexity. This is better, it´s incredibly true to the style and balanced. Loads of outhouse, farm, grass, yeast and funk in this one. There is massive amount of fruits, some mango, grape, citrus, but very subtle and balanced. It´s quite refreshing but is demanding a lot from your sences. Fantastic stuff!

From a 75 cl bottle at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen, Denmark. Hazy golden, medium white head. Fruity with notes of pineapple and mango. Light to medium bodied, medium to high carbonation. Dry with a soft acidity. Very tasty and refreshing.

750 ml bottle @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours a slightly cloudy colour with a foamy white head. Aroma of wheat, strong brett and citus. Flavour of wheat, white grapes, floral hops, brett and maltiness. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Finishes floral, spicy and mellow on sweetness. Really refreshing and summery. Great stuff.

75 cl bottle @ Mikkeller & Friends.
Pours clear golden color with a medium sized white head. Aroma yeast, barnyard notes, citrus fruits and spices. Flavour of citrus fruits, lemon, some spices, apricot, grapes and mild goose berries. Sour, yet quite crisp fruity palate, mouth-drying finish. Very nice.

750ml bottle @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen

Pours clear yellow with a small foamy head. Aroma of funky bretta notes, fruity hops, farmyard and citrusy notes. Taste is tart, fruity and zesty with bretta, citrus and yeasty farmyard notes. Finish is tart and sourish with lots of bretta and fruity notes. Nice, quite funky and tart, but balanced saison.
Bottle. Musty lemon malt aroma.  Cloudy yellow with moderate head.  Sweet musty lemon, brett, and malt flavor.  Excellent.
Bottle share at DLD. Funky bretty yeast and citrus aroma. Cloudy yellow with a large white head. Funky brett, citrus, and coriander flavor. Smooth creamy body. Very nice.
Bottle.  Slightly hazy yellow pour, with a fluffy white head.  Grain, yeasty, light funk, a bit tart, lemon vest, and white pepper.  A pretty nice easy drinking saison.

750ml bottle generously shared by Max at Zach & Matts tasting. Pours clear gold with a huge white head. Aroma is a beautiful sour lemon rind and lemon juice. Theres also a light funkiness in the aroma. Taste is tart/sour but soft at the same time. Its drinks like an incredibly simple beer but theres also so much going on.  This is a terrific beer, a lovely saison.

750mL Bottle, purchased somewhere in Vermont last year. Aroma is a graceful, webby pretty, punctuated with sand and wind. This is a nice beer, if straightforward and a little less layered than other Saisons from HF. I really enjoy the simple, lemon tartness of this. Its clean and straight talking. In some ways, it feels like if Berliner Weisse picked up a fluffy, Belgian affect. A nice, easy drinker.

Bottle shared at Hunhapu day, poured a light hazy yellow color with aromas of light barnyard, floral notes and some light spice.  Flavors are the same, light on the palate and refreshing in the heat, another solid beer from these guys.

Bottle. Pours unclear yellow with a small frothy white head. Aroma is lime, honey, grass, light malts, zest, a little pepper and funk. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter and light+ tangy. Body is near medium, texture is oily, carbonation is moderate+. Finishes balanced and tangy. Dry in the late finish.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2016 Bottle. Hazy yellow with a thick bubbly good lacing white head. Aroma is flowery, light herbal, raspberries, lime peel, light phenolic. Taste is light/medium sweet, light+ sour and light bitter. Very light astringent. Light/medium body, oily texture, soft+ carbonation. Light sour and dry fruity finish.


Edit: Upping this from 3.7. Cirtusy, crisp and super refreshing.
Botella. Cloudy yellow to golden colour, medium white head, good lacing. Pleasant lemony sweet aroma with yeast and soap. Good mouthfeel. Lemon citric tart plesant swtt like flavour, yeasty, dry,

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2013 Pours straw yellow with a frothy, active, white head. Nose is a bit of barnyard, soap, and mellow hops.  Flavor is lemon peel and Belgian yeast. This is a very refreshing traditional saison that is well executed all around.  

UPDATE: Almost four months later, Im drinking another bottle of this and thinking even more of it than my initial rating of 4 would indicate. Im also now getting a bit of brett and sourness from this saison this time around. I think some of the hops that covered these flavors initially have faded somewhat.  Whats left is even more delicious, and Ive adapted my score to reflect this.

Chilled 75 cl brown bottle poured into a tulip.  Pours golden with big fluffy white head.  Little lacing, medium body, and light floral aroma.  Taste is delicate floral, and light tartness.  Taste is complex, delicate floral, and light tartness.

Draft at Churchkey. Poured a slightly hazy golden color with a medium sized white head - later pours were huge, thick white colored heads. Aroma was some light spice notes, plenty of yeast notes, light malts. Flavor was some funk, with spices, yeast. Relatively solid.

Bomber. Thanks to Chris H. Very smooth, yeasty, and light honeyish aroma. Cloudy glowing yellow, with a big creamy head, and good lace. Catches fire from the first sip, and produces huge and unusual high palate/sinus hits of fruit and acid. Lemony. the finish is smooth and satisfying. Thin body, but very spritzy. Wow!

750ml bottle purchased during the Norma release. Poured into a tulip glass. Opens with a slight gush over.

A - Pours a hazy dark yellow body. Tons of white soapy foam that fills the rest of the glass. It eventually settles down into a half finger cap. Excellent lacing and retention.

S - Pretty much exactly what I want out of a saison. Lots of lemons, wheat, grass, and a pleasant and soft earthiness. Smell is just super inviting. 

T - Tart lemons and big blast of wheat and grain. Kind of bready. A bit of a funky earthiness to balance it out. Some bitterness and spicy black peppercorn on the finish which Im not a huge fan of. It is very drinkable and the pepper is not at all overpowering, I just dont enjoy any pepper like flavors in a beer. Mouth feel is medium bodied and well carbonated with a clean finish.

O - A damn solid saison, but I much prefer Anna or Florence over this. It is rustic and a bit spicy and bready. I just prefer fruitier and sweeter saisons.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2013 Shared with Pixachii. Pours a hazy golden color with a big, frothy, bone-white head. recedes to about two milimeters and retains. Citrusy and zesty with a touch of banana, but lots of hay and bucolic funk. I think it smells really tasty. Tastes zesty and citrusy. A little bitter, but sweet, spicy and refreshing. carbonation is light-medium. Just enough to really hit the spot.

Old review - On tap at la Laiterie 2010. Pours slightly hazy golden yellow with a nice lofty off white head that suspends. Smell is spice, pepper, grass, malt...complex. Taste is must, funk, orange zest. Light/medium body with subtle carbonation...really nice.

Bottle from gnosis.. thank you.. Pour is a nice straw yellow with 3 finger fluffy white head. Aroma is lemon, pepper, floral, yeasty. Taste is nice and tart.. lemon peel, brett, crackers. Nice carbonation..a bit creamy. A very good saison.

750ml bottle. Faintly cloudy gold with a medium head, and nice spotty lacing. Its got a bright nose with an unexpected youthful tartness, plenty of earthy yeast and spice. Hops are more evident in the taste, along with a fantastic spice/tartness interface thats tough as hell to pull. Something fragrant and almost buttery (though in no way diacetyl) warms the core, absolutely fantastic stuff overall.

750ml bottle.  Gushed, hate that.  Pours a clear gold with some frothy, white head.  Nose is fairly mild, grassy, honey, hay, lots of esters though, banana, a little hand soap.  Flavor is sweet, grass, hay, light honey, some light white bread.  Lightly watery, clean finish.  A fine saison, but I know they do better.
Nose of rare hay herb and musty pontificating douches.  Gold pour thin head.  Flavors of lemon acidity herb and dusty. A little funky. Rare. 6 people here creamed their pants upon opening.

Pours a light gold with a thick white head. Aroma of grain, citrus and funk. Taste follows, tart and dry. Insanely good

another beer from whatsarezaf thank you this poured a bright but hazy yellow.
really dry some pepper notes very well balanced tho lighter fruit notes had a thick withe head these guys really know how to brew some beer

Bottle shared at RBWG, hotel lobby session 
Appearance: Clear yellow with a big white head and lot of lacing 
Lemon, floral, yeasty and vinegar ,br>
Nice, mild and easy drinking.

The beverage has a nice carbonation. The aroma has noticeable fruit, yeast, hop, and grain notes. I am able to taste lemon, yeast, sugar, hops, and barley. Overall a nice refreshing drink that is very kind to the palate.
Bottle at RBWG. Thanks Brad. Earthy and floral. Very floral, wheatgrass, wheat, oak... A little bit of funk. Interesting.
Thanks to Andrew for this pour.  Tart lemons funky earthy.  Lots of dough and yeast in the nose.  Light tart dry lemon fruit flavors.  A super solid funky beer.   Tasty. 8/4/8/4/16
Bouteille 750mL. Blonde trouble a mousse abondante. Nez de citron et yuzu. Bouche moyenne marquee par l'acidite. Saveurs de tartre, de citron et de brett.

750, capped, at MIkkeller. Pours a hazy dark straw color with a loose and eggy white head. Lots of carb. Nice rustic nose, a little barnyard but not much--some grassy and slight lemon notes. Creamy medium body with bright carb. Toasty crackeriness under a nice bread crust, lemon, and barnyard mid palate. Crisp dry grassy finish. Very nice saison.

Pours a hazy light straw yellow with a white lacing. The aroma is barnyard notes, dough, floral and a hint of grass. Somewhat bready. Highly carbonated although according to the description not force carbonated. There is an initial sweetness that fades into bitter.
75 cl bottle. Hazy yellow beer with a big white head. Sourish and fruity aroma. A bit vinous, sourish, fruitya and citrus flavour. Lovely beer :-)
Aroma of honey, wildflower and lemongrass.  Pours hazy heady blonde.  Taste is tart with grass, lemon and notes of honeysuckle nectar.  Very good!
Draft at lord hobo, another great Saison from hill farmstead. Grassy, herbal, lemon zest, peppery, floral notes, coriander. Very good

Pours a cloudy golden color with a thick white head. Superb aroma of funk, yeast, sourness and some spices. Very good flavor of sourness, yeast, barnyard, spices. The body is medium with a creamy, slightly oily texture and medium to lively carbonation. I dont know what Shaun Hill does to his saisons, but theyre damn good.

Draft at Gingerman. The aroma is grassy, funk, lemon, earth, spice. High carbonation and medium bodied. Complex flavors - white pepper, vanilla, yeasty esters. Earthy hops on the finish. Great saison.

750 ml bottle.  Pours a hazy light yellow golden color with a medium sizedwhite head.  The aroma is herbal, funky,  citrus, woody, grassy with some white peppery notes. Draft at TRBAG. Pours a golden straw color with nice fluffy head that leaves some lacing. tart, grassy,tons of citrus notes with juicy tropical fruit tartness in the finish.  dry, medium-light mouthfeel. good carbonation.  lovely beer.

[4918-20121102] 750mL bottle. Lemony yeast aroma. Murky, light yellow orange body with a medium-lasting foamy white head. Light citrus banana yeast and lemon peels flavour. Medium body is quite tangy. Good, interesting to try. (8/3/8/3/16) 3.8

750ml bottle-shared @dmacs from trade with hbmason, thanks Tim-thin white-hazy yellow.  A-yeast, spice, lt malt-bready, grass/barn.  T-tart lemon, yeast, spice, lt malt-bready, grass/barn.

Poured from a 750ml bottle thanks to lukaduke. Pours a hazy straw color with a white head of foam. The aroma is bready, dry, sort of hoppy, and just on the verge of tartness. The taste is hoppy bitter at first and moves toward a dry almost tart note. Another great beer from Hill Farmstead.

My bottle [750ml] shared with HogTownHarry, GregClow, jerc & mabel -- c/o Glouglouburp. Nov. 2. Pours a murky pale yellow with an average size lasting foamy white head. Bottle...  Poured pale, golden/yellow with a thin forming, white head.  Earthy, grassy, some citrus.  But loads of yeast flavor and spice.  Some light fruit esters and a mild (very mild) funk when searching for it.  Balanced, but sort of one-dimensional.

Nice hazy straw light orange. No head.

Bottle at home with my dad, courtesy of Adam. Big thanks for this one man!!!. Pour is hazy lemon peel in appearance with a huge, long-lasting white head and great lacing. Aroma is musty, lemon peel, band-aid, rubber, dusty, biscuit, hay, and honeycomb. Medium body with fizzy carbonation and a crisp lingering finish. Earthy, spritzy, sweet, tangy, and refreshing. Another awesome saison. Nice!!

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2013 A-filtered effervescent golden yellow. One finger of pillowy white head with sturdy lacing. S-tropical fruits, lemon, grapefruit and powerful cloves up front. Some texture, lightly sticky malts and tangy notes ss well: T-tart citrus fruits, lemon, orange and grapefruit, to start. Apricot, citrusy zest and sour white grapes in the middle. Grass, soapy notes and some bubble gum on the lasting finish O - a really nice subtle but complex saison. . A great balancing act. Light tartness, subtle funk, fruity, and dry and grassy with quiet Belgian hints. 4.3

2012-11-02. Hazy pastel yellow, large fluffy white head. 3+ Interesting aroma, lemon notes, light yeast character. Thanks to Mista for sharing this.  Golden color, small white head.  Aromas of funky citrus.  Taste is dry and tart, really refreshing, a bit of funk.  Carbonation is on the high side.  Until I tried this I would have told you I dont like Saisons but this was pretty great.

Glowing yellow liquid topped by a nice and white bubbly head. Aromas of barnyard and citrus. Refreshing acidity with more lemon and hay in the taste. Yeasty like any good saison, it was plenty refreshing and good.
75cl, new exclusive American brew Anno 2010, thx to Secret Santa!, complex brew, malty/fruity and slightly sour/bitter, easy to drink, balanced, cloudy, rocky head, nice brew, yet expensive!
Thanks Tommy! Hazy Golden with a thick frothy head. Funky and sour aroma lots of lemon. Taste is very tart with some barnyard yeast and a little bread dough malt. Really nice!

Huge thanks to Jcwatts for bringing this to Dmacs. Pours out a clear, light golden color with a small white head. Aroma is of light grains, fruity esters, light hops and a good dose of some funky tartness. Taste is complex, lemon zest, oak, grainy notes, light fruit and a good lightly funky tartness going on throughout. Once again, this is a really tasty beer, huge thanks John.

Bottle shared by starrdogg. Thanks Matt.

Served along side Hill Farmstead Art, Flora, Civil Disobedience, and McKenzie Irma Extra.

The beer is hazy and yellow hued with a thick, white head that leaves ample lacing on the snifter. The aroma brings floral, citrus, malt, yeast. The flavor is decent. Bottle shared by jcwattsruger, thanks John. Poured a golden straw body, completely opaque when the yeast from the bottom of the bottle was poured, an average sized foamy white head leaves lots of lace all over my New Belgium tulip. Flavor of chardonnay, yeast, lemons, band aid, tartness, spices, just complex with lots going on. This is a great beer overall.

On draft at HFS Harvest and multiple bottles shared over the last month....Pours a nice golden color with a lively froth... great aromas of funky tart citrus, white pepper and barnyard yeast. 750ml. Bottle. Huge thanks to Ernesto987! Pours hazy opaque pale yellow with a tight soapy white head that fades to a film and sudsy collar. Aroma  is tart lemon funk yeast and grassy notes. UPDATED: DEC 17, 2013 Bottle - thanks Jeff! Bright yellow pour with some haziness. White head. Yeast, sour, Brett, lemon / citrus. Unbelievable beer.
UPDATED: DEC 29, 2012 Bottle shared by joey at lunch. Huge carbonation, nice nose, funky tart lemon zest and tangerine peel. Really clean saison incredible balance between the citrus and funk

Finish is sour, dry and tart with lemon juice, dry wood, lemon zest, dry soil, barnyard, unripe tropical fruits, crackers and sour green apples. Extremely nice and refreshing!

(Bottle) Pours hazy pale yellow with a large, off-white head. Fancy, bright and well balanced nose. The flavour is dry, medium acidic and tiny bitter with notes of wood, spices, tart/acidic fruits, tight malt and subtle hops. The mouthfeel is tart, bright and light watery with medium carbonation. Citric and light spicy finish. Light bodied.

Bottle at Bomber-o-rama, Göteborg. Hazy pale yellow beer with a rich white head. Funky perfume aroma, leather, barnyard, hay, grapefruit, slightly grassy, citrus, pine, grapes, earthy notes, sourish, vinegar notes. Bottle shared by drewbeerme. Pours a very attractive glowing gold, frothy white head. The nose is fantastic. Lightly tart, bretty, barnyard and pils malt. Light herbal hops. Really fresh and clean. Pretty superb saison that is how I expect 5th element was prior going totally sour. A bit more body and this would destroy everything.

Draft at Eulogy. Hazy golden yellow with a fizzy frothy white head. Nice full saison with a good mix of dry and sour. Ripe Meyer lemons. Big grassy notes. Tasting Brett. Good carbonation. This is ridiculously good.  Straight lemon saison DuPont.  Excellent!!!

tap at farmhouse fest.pours  gold with big ol head. aroma of tart hop. taste is very hoppy and funky i like it

Bottle thanks to Bonke. Hazy golden. Hay, general barnyard, grass, lemon, spices. Refreshing, dry finish, medium body. Favorite saison thus far.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 Hazy yellow-orange body.  Large fluffy white head, spotty lacing.  Mellow lemon zest, grain, hay, grassy hops, a bit of yeasty zip, light spicing.  Flavor is quite similar to the nose.  Medium bodied.  Quite dry and refreshing. A nice saison, lacking something special to really set it apart though.

750ml bottle, consumed on the same day as Anna. The pour yields a lightly hazy, beautiful golden body that shines brightly in the light and shows consistently streaming micro-bubbles. A short but steadfast blanket of creamy, snow-white foam sits at the head, giving tissue-thin, tattered sheets of lace to the glass.  The nose is masterfully simple, based in über-fresh malted grain with dry, peppery, floral yeast and crisp notes of grassy hops. Like in Anna, there is a suggestion of wet hay or straw that lends a bit of farmhouse character, but missing is her subtle honey kiss and wildflower complexity. This one is more classic saison.  Flavors follow the nose, crisp and snappy, biting grass bitterness showing atop a base of fresh cereal, hay, and dried bread. White pepper and other dry spice show in the yeast profile. The palate is dry as a bone, laced with lively carbonation that quickly clears away what little residuals the fully-attenuated, moderate body leaves behind. Damn fine beer. Not quite the showstopper that Anna is, but an excellent example of a straight-up, classic saison. Close your eyes and youre instantly transported back in time to the fields of Wallonia.

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2013 Bottle from BeerPilgrim11.  Aside from a small taste of Anna at the Hunahpu release (thanks to whoever that was) this is my first Hill Farmstead brew. Smells a little like doing spring yard work with flowers, herbs, and freshly mowed grass.  Definitely can pick up the use of Euro hops in the scent.  The flavor follows in line with that.  Theres lots of crisp grass, straw, and bready notes leading the way with spring flowers mixing in.  This kind of tastes like a Pilsner colliding with a Saison.  Its clean and refreshing, and just a solid brew to kick back to on a warm day, which is exactly what I did.  Great beer!

A - 3-finger crystal clear head that shimmers like crystal. Very tight bubbles almost creamy. The beer is a hazy golden color. Deep orange gold color. Gorgeous beer.

S - Great spices like pepper and some other very bitey spice. Loving the very bready and sort of butter-like croissant scent. Theres a terrific tangy scent that you related to great farmhouse saisons and a lot of dry white-wine appeal. Id be happy just smelling this beer! 

T - Dry Saison is what I first get. The spice is a bit too much but its not terrible, Im just not a fan of so much spice. Maybe thats why they call this a "rustic" saison. Very dry finish which pulls the spice away leaving a lingering tangy taste.

M - Huge explosion of bubbles on the swish but not bubbles that expand your cheeks. Carbonation without full-ness. Very nice. Light bodied and easy to drink

O - Id like this beer. HFSs Anna I prefer but this is still a solid Saison but just a little spicy for me.

Revising this to a 4.8. I reviewed this earlier in the year. The latest batches are more tart / sour. The spice is almost gone, still a little buttery on the nose. These beers are starting to sour and Im sure its intentional. Going to save my other 3 of these for a year and hope they develop into something else.

27th February 2012Bottle shared by Leighton - cheers ears! Light haze on this gold beer, good white head. Light dry palate. Trace of brett. Creamy malt. Mild minerals. Better than some of the other Hill Farmstead Saisons but generally not getting the esteem in which they are held. No matter - all their other beers are great!

750 ml bottle; cloudy light yellow with thick egg white head; light pepper, lemony hay, white sugar; thin, crisp, honey; clean, mild noble hops and orange peel; dry, clean finish; not as standout as Anna, but really nice

Bottle 750ml.Clear medium orange yellow colour with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, wheat notes, moderate hoppy, flowers, moderate to light light heavy yeasty, fruity, coriander. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate bitter with a long duration, chrispy. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120128]
Bottle, pours bright yellow, this is just a good example of a basic saison, it was neither amazing nor bad. But it had a solid thin body and smooth finish

Huge thanks to Peter for sharing this bottle at the STL RB gathering.  Pour is very light yellow with a sizable fluffy, white head.  The appearance belies the tremendous flavor and aroma.  Loads of lemon, champagne-like dryness, hay, faint funk, light spice, and a touch of pepper. This beer was a huge hit for me. Its so clean yet so complex. This beer makes me think there may be a bit of terroir in beers because the few beers that I have had from this place all seem to have a faint earthiness and rounded spice profile that I cannot get enough of. Damn good.

Bottle shared at CBC one of Nates last nights. Pours hazy yellow-gold with a large, frothy white head. Lovely aroma, all yeast, lemon and dough. Light to medium sweet flavor, some doughy bread, light spice, light bitterness, yeast, faint citrus. Light bodied with average to lively carbonation. Clean, fresh, bready finish, some mild yeast, light lemon and citrus rind. Just a damn good saison. Doesnt try to blow the top off. Just makes it do what it do, baby.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2013 750 ml bottle sent by lushawn- thanks again, Shawn! Pours a somewhat cloudy yellow, pale gold color with a huge eggshell white head. Aroma of dry grains, bready malts, horseblanket, herbs, straw, citrus fruist, and mild spices. Flavor of herbs, citrus, bread, grass, funk, coriander, and dusty, dry grains. Light-medium bodied, with medium carbonation and a crisp, dry, funky mouthfeel. Re-Rate: Tried a green label (non-infected) next to a blue label (infected), and damn if the infected one isnt better. The bretty funk adds a new dimension of tartness and more funk to the huskiness and dry cobwebs. Sour. Nice. The blue was a 4.1 for me and regular a 3.9 so the rating stays a 4.

Tasted from tall bottle at 2nd STL Ratebeer Gathering, thanks phaleslu! Poured a light golden color with some chill haze and LOTS of fluffy white foam, long-lasting with exquisite Belgian lace. Aromas of straw, cut grass, mild malt, faint flowery hops, plus wildly diverse yeast phenols: black pepper, clove, healthy compost, even a hint of that elusive horse-blanket thing which sounds disgusting but is amazing. Tasted of a basic light ale grainbill, freshly baked bread, some citrus-rind, and again, cool layers of fermentation flavors. Light, classic "digestive" Belgian body and mouthfeel, fruity aftertaste which eventually finished super-dry. So incredibly delicious. A highlight of my night, for sure.
(bottle - sampled at STL RB Gathering) slightly hazy yellow gold with white head. Aroma of yeast, wheat, spice. Flavor is wheat, yeast, spice, green apples.
UPDATED: JUN 27, 2012 All shauns beers taste rediciously fresh. Awesome yeast strain. Awe snap! Keep on keepin on!

Bottle 75 cl. Yellow, lightly hazy with a dense white head leaving laces. Yeast and flowers in the nose. Medium-bodied with a dry fruitiness and yeast and a lightly phenollic (?) edge. Finishes dry with some bitterness. Decent alright but less subtle and refined than Vera Mae. 310112

Bottled. A hazy light yellow beer with a huge white head. The aroma has notes of pepper, malt, and lemon. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemons, peaches, pepper, malt, and hay, leading to a bitter finish.
Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, wheaty, yeasty and spicy. Flavor is medium sweet and light acidic. Dry finish. 280112
Hazy yellow of color with a white head. An aroma of wheat, spice, soap, sweets and citrus. A flavor of spice, citrus, earth, weak sweets and dry finish.
Bottle. Hazy dark yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, fruit, coriander and spices. Flavour is malt, fruit, yeast, little coriander, hops, little orange peel and a little bitter.

Bottle @ Too many Geuzes - only one toilet , Ulfborg 2012. Pours unclear yellow with a large frothy head. Spices, hay and yeast. Mild and inviting nose. Clean and refreshing. Easy with a large drinkability. Sean can still do no wrong!
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with excellent duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are yeast, malt, fruits, flowers and hops.

Yellow like mountain dew. White poofs all about. Smells like malt and hops, pre mash/boil. A little do the dew-y actually. Hmm. Cirtrus. Bubbly, orangey, and not bitter. Unfiltered, wheat taste. Tangy? Salright.

Pours hazy straw orange, huge fluffy head with great retention and lacing, lively bubbles visible.  All these HF brews look pretty great.  On the nose is heavy yeast character, bready pale malts, overtones of lemon citrus, floral hops.  Taste is very much a mirror of the nose- pale malts with nice, lemony, some mineral character, yeast, and soft herbal hops in the aftertaste.  Feels great in the mouth, not too thin, and dry.  Lovely straightforward saison with great balance, but lacking some of the complexities Ive enjoyed in other HF offerings.

Served on-tap at Capones into a sampler glass.

A - Pours pale yellow with a strong one finger head, dissipating to a light film of head, leaving thin sheets of lacing down the glass

S - Tons of breadyness up front with a bit of funk. A bit dry with some hints of citric hops and fruits. The bready mix of malt and yeast really dominated the other flavors a bit too much.

T - Starts off with plenty of bready yeast up front giving way quickly to a mix of muted grassy hops and citric fruits. M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Fairly heavy, chewy, feel with plenty of it lingering long after consumption.

D - Good not great. I liked it but I prefer my saisons to be a little cleaner and funkier. I just dont seem to like these bready saisons very much I guess.

Bottle, bought @ Ølbutikken, Cph.
Pours a nice hazy pale golden with a magnificent, staying, frothy, white head. Aroma has green grapes, green apples, fresh cut grass, crisp and light doughy malts, a slight bit of funk. Roses, crisp malts, good hoppy dryness, sharpish white pepper, grass, green apples, light zesty and still just an indication of funk. Lovely saison.
750 thanks to Glouglouburp. Yeasty and dry saison. Nice sense of grape, white wine, apricot. Very nice.

Clean rusty yellow appearance; sweet, soft herbal aroma shows banana, cinnamon, white pepper and stone fruits in its first subdued pulse; underneath, sauv blanc like aromas of minerals and tart white fruits; and finally, a richness of herbs and pungent garlic cloves licked with sugar.  It nails that complicated-calm thing that the style exemplifies.
It feels and tastes a bit more undetailed at first.  Tarragon, banana, lemon zest, seeds.  It seems sweet and lacks the kick I want.  But as it coats the mouth, theres layers of citrus and stone fruits that begin to provide layers of detailed acidity and tangy sweetness, and this is cut with the bitter dryness of cardamom and sesame seeds.
The palate is spritzy and sharp at first, but settles down, smooth and pillowy with an awesome acidic edge that feels only of fruits and never of vinegar.  It finishes with a dusty, floral flavor mingled with a dry pear skin flavor, and lingers long.  Its a great take on the style that that hasnt even begun to show the potential of its details yet, at which point it could be something truly extraordinary.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2012 On tap at Hill Farmsteads first anniversary celebration. Although I was really in the mood for bretty deliciousness, this brew offered an welcome change from the tart palate wreckers I found myself spending so much time with on Saturday. Typical saison pour- hazy peach with a massive white head. The aroma held an awesome balance of fruity dough, citrus fruit, and cereal grains. The flavor was much the same, with a perfect melding of flavor profiles. The palate, like every other beer of the day, was truly phenomenal. Perfect supple carbonation and dry finish.

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2016 My Bottom Line:
This Saisons seamless intertwining of ingredients is softly and eloquently expressed from aroma to finish in the cushiest of airy bodies. Orange-y zest, cereals, farmhouse yeast and spicy hops unite and become a single complex entity. Wow.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A thick, creamy head of foam decorates the misty translucent golden.
-The fluffy mouthfeel is absolutely divine; perfectly quenching while delivering all the flavors this brew can present.
-The fruity character can easily come from spices, hops and/or esters. The flavor profile is so tight, individual ingredients are hard to dissociate. Bravo! 
-The aroma is simply tantalizing.
-This has to be bottled. I know Art is bottled, but this source brew deserves its place in the spotlight too. If anything, it might even be more drinkable. And such a bottling might take care of the disparate ratings its been getting...

On draft at Capones.  Pours a slightly cloudy yellow orange straw gold with a frosty medium sized white head.  Aroma is peppery with hints of banana, lemon zest, cloves and bubble gum.  Taste of cloves, peppery notes, bubble gum and coriander.

The saison pours amber with yellow and orange blended hues. There is some fair lacing on a decent head. The aroma is light with great barnyard and earthy notes. The flavor has moderate sweetness on that funky saison flavor from that trademark yeast. The body is medium and creamy and enjoyed on tap at Capones thoroughly for a great Hill Farmstead event.

Sampled from the tap at the brewery. Poured a cloudy pale yellow with a white head that lasted throughout the beer. Aroma was full of floral notes with some light citrus and fruit notes as well as a bit of spice. Flavor had more light citrus present that combined nicely with the floral notes and was supported by spice, light fruit and some sweet grain.
On tap at Capones. Moderate grapefruit flavor over citrus, coriander, fruit. Mild-moderate bitterness, moderate sweetness.

On draft at Capones.

Pours a hazy golden yellowish orange color with pale golden yellow hues when held to a light source and a 1.5 fingerfrothy white head that slowly fades into a lastig ring. Decent amount of lacing left behind.

Slightly floral aroma with lots of bready yeast notes as well as some estery light fruit, zesty spice and citrus peel. Hints of pepper, coriander, orange peel and pear in the nose.

Chewy medium body with a lot of bready yeast which contributes to the moutfeel. There is also a lot of zesty peppery spice up front with more coriander and lemon zest. Hints of sweet citrus and crisp light fuir, especially orange peel, apple and pear. Not a bery high ABV but the alcohol presence is still felt. A bit overly spicy and hit but the nice mouthfeel helps the drinkability.

On tap at Capones.  Lightly hazed yellow brown with a splotch.  Nose is citrus pith and peel with dough and yeast.  Medium light with a refreshing tingle.  Taste is vibrant orange and lemon zest, light toffee and green banana yeast.  Finishes dry with grass and pine.  Maybe the best saison ive tried since the Southampton brewpub bottled stuff.

Growler thanks to afrantzell.  Pours golden and clear with a small white head and some lacing.  The aroma is great, with honey and grains, floral notes and spice, maybe light fruits.  Very nice flavor, not too sweet with a pale malt base, honey, pepperiness, Belgian yeast, and hop bitterness.  Medium-bodied with a dry crisp mouthfeel and a good level of carbonation.   Really good saison - best of this style Ive had from Hill Farmstead so far.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2010 Location: Draft at Blind Tiger, 12/18/10


Aroma: The nose is yeasty, some funk/brett, earthy notes, and spice

Appearance: It pours a cloudy golden color, big white head, lots of lace

Flavor: It has a clean grassy and earthy feel, a bit of brett, but not lot, yeast, toast, light fruity sweetness

Palate: This one is clean and smooth on the mouth, low carbonation, good drinkability

Overall Impression: 
I liked this beer quite a bit, it was a nice crisp clean saison with a touch of funk.  Well-made stuff.  This is the first thing Ive tried from Hill Farmstead Brewery, and I look forward to enjoying more of their brews.

UPDATED: SEP 26, 2012 In short: A very rustic Saison with a generous amount of fruity grassy hops.  Great session beer.
How: Many 750ml bottles
The look: Partly cloudy blonde body topped by a large white head with good rentention and leaving good lacings
In long: Nose is very rustic (almost wild) just how I like it from a Saison, a side of banana cake and bright shinning grassy and fruity hops.  Mouthfeel is just Wow!  Very lively very clean.  Taste is uber-crisp crackery malts, plenty of rustic yeast and a generous amount of fruity hops and yellowed grass.  Fruity notes of citrus, tropical fruits and a bit of bananas.  The most recent batch is drier than erlier batches and it works so well with the rest of the beer that Im raising my score.  The bitterness of medium intensity is perfectly levelled.  This is a fantastic thirst quencher just like any Saison should be.  Im glad to see this new for the brewer/owner to see that his new brewery is already getting praised from many people.  Id like to have the motivation to start my own business.  Maybe I should read a motivational book but the bookstore is all the way down the block.

On tap at the Ginger Man, and at Blind Tiger during their Hill Farmstead events.  Pours a hazed amber with a thin white head.  Soft musk and wheat on the nose.  Very musky and toast.  Musky, sweet and lovely.  This may be the most perfect table beer I have come across.  Nothing overwhelming, full of subtlety and nuance, and just a delightful beer.

Tap at BT.  Pours a hazed medium to deep blonde with a thin lasting white head- nice lace.  Aroma is earthy, spicy, phenolic, clean white wine yeast/clean brett yeast - phenolic, yeasty, smooth light plastic phenol- reminds me of my fantome black ghost brett yeast- not real funky, some slight clean phenolic, lemon, earthy nice fresh hay, and some citrusy notes on a dusty crackery malt backbone.  Flavor is grass, herbs, slight citrus, good clean fresh pale malt - cracker, dust, biscuit, slight toast, phenolic, light fruitiness, lemonzest, and a very unique mouthfeel- light dusty, earth prickliness while remaining mostly dry with light lemon and pepper left on the tongue.  Good easy, everyday drinking saison.  Nice!

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2011 Draught at TJs:  Aroma of wheat, light banana, citrus, lemon, saison yeast, slight spices, slight coriander, clove, and some grass.  Poured yellow/gold/amber in color with a small, creamy, white head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Lightly sparkling.  Opaque.  Some small particles throughout.  Excellent lacing.  Flavor is lightly sweet.  Tastes of saison yeast, citrus, light wheat, grain, light spices, clove, light coriander, light bubblegum, and some caramel.  Light to medium body.  Lightly dry, lightly sticky body.  Average texture.  Saison yeast, light citrus, clove, coriander, light spice, wheat, and grain finish is dry.

growler filled earlier today poured a darker golden in color and formed a covering of white head. aroma has wheat, grass, earthy yeast, lemon pulp, sweet flowers, real honey, and a bit of barnyard. mouth feel is light but it coats well and there is gentle low carbonation. flavor gets some malt going, medium bitterness, dry lemon, barnyard hay, belgian yeast, wet herbs, and a nice fitting hop level. this is well crafted and got better for me towards the end of the glass.

Tart, citrusy aroma with trademark saison yeast and spice. Nice, fluffy head that laces well and sticks around for a while. Light, refreshing flavor with  citrus and hops in excellent balance. Nice dry finish and just a touch of hops.

Growler sample shared with oakbluff. Gold in colour, with light haze and medium carbonation. Classic Saison Dupont-like aromas, with notes of mild tropical fruit, honeycomb, earth, flowers, and herbal hop cone. Light bodied and very dry in the mouth, with flavours of grasses, flowers, forest floor and citrus pith. Very appetizing and refreshing. One of the best American made saisons that Ive ever tried.
Poured a cloudy golden color with an averaged sized white head. Aromas of citrus, yeasty/breadiness, and spices. Tastes of citrus, spices, toastiness, and earthy.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2011 Pours a hazy golden orange with a medium creamy/bubbly white head.  Aroma of citrusy hop notes, bready malt, spicy and fruity saison yeast notes.  Flavor of bready malt, lightly earthy, pine and citrusy notes.  Moderate hop bitterness.  Nice and dry.  A bit bitter for a saison.

Re-Rate - Had this again at Capones on tap.  A lot of my notes are the same as above but the bitterness has been taken down a notch really increasing the overall taste.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2011 On tap at HF first anniversary.
Appearance : Almost clear yellow with awesome white foamy head. VERY nice looking. Extensive lacing.

Aroma :  Awesome yeast with light rustic funk. Nice herbal hops with notes of hay. Notes of wet grass.

Taste : Awesome yeast with light spices. Very nice malt. Finish is nicely yeasty with light funk and awesome malt.

Overall : Wow this one was in good shape. I think this batch was much better than when I first had it. One of the best looking beer ever. Nose is devine with the nice funk the awesome malt and the nice herbal hops. Taste also very nice. Highly drinkable. My best Saison ever. Stunning beer.


On tap at Hill Farmstead.
Appearance : Hazy pale yellow with a big foamy head. Lots of lacing.

Aroma : Nice wild and fresh. Quite crisp. light barnyard. Nice yeast. Citrusy and a bit tart.

Taste : Crisp and herbal hops. A little bit tart and citrusy. Nice bitter herbal finish.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2012 Hazy dark golden color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of toasted malts, pils malt, some honey, toffee, grass, and light citrus fruits.  Taste of dry toasted malts, some grass, citrus, light pepper, and finishing dry.
